FLOLTH
Fléau d'armes drow + 3
Le fléau d'armes est constitué d'un manche en bois avec au bout, séparé par une articulation ou une chaîne, une barre de fer, une barre de bois avec des piquants ou une boule de métal avec des pointes. Cette arme était à l'origine un outil agricole pour battre le grain.

Comme la plupart des objets drows, cet objet est fait d'adamantium, alliage d'adamantite qui tombe rapidement en poussière s'il quitte l'Ombre-Terre.

 PARAMÈTRES :

TAC0 : +3
Dégâts : 1d6+4 (contondants)
Facteur de vitesse : 4
Type de compétence : fléau d'armes / morgenstern
Type : arme à une main
Nécessite : 13 en force

Poids : 15

Comme la plupart des objets drows, cet objet est fait d'adamantium, alliage d'adamantite qui tombe rapidement en poussière s'il quitte l'Ombre-Terre.

FREERING
Anneau d'action libre
Anneau d'action libre : « Cadeau d'Edventar »
Cet anneau fut donné à Edventar, le chasseur et écumeur de récifs, par un groupe d'elfes aquatiques, ses amis de longue date. En aidant dans sa fuite Yenandra de Dambrath, la « Reine des Pirates », Edventar leur permit en effet de survivre. Mais Yenandra est toujours crainte le long de toutes les côtes.

PARAMÈTRES :

Capacités d'équipement :
- Le porteur est immunisé contre tout ce qui, magique ou non, pourrait affecter sa mobilité, y compris les sorts de rapidité et de ralentissement.

Poids : 0

GODBOW
Arc court
Les arcs courts ont été fabriqués avant les autres, même s'ils ne s'appelaient pas encore ainsi. Ce terme est utilisé par défaut pour désigner tout ce qui n'est pas un arc long. Les branches d'arc court mesurent 1,5 m en moyenne. Avec les années, on s'est efforcé d'améliorer la portée de l'arc. Tantôt on augmentait la longueur des branches, tantôt on améliorait leur flexibilité sans modifier leur longueur. La première expérience a engendré ce qui s'appelle aujourd'hui l'arc long. 

PARAMÈTRES :

Facteur de vitesse : 6
Type de compétence : arc court
Type : arme à deux mains
Nécessite : 3 en Force

Poids : 2
Les arcs courts ont été fabriqués avant les autres, même s'ils ne s'appelaient pas encore ainsi. Ce terme est utilisé par défaut pour désigner tout ce qui n'est pas un arc long. Les branches d'arc court mesurent 1,5 m en moyenne. Avec les années, on s'est efforcé d'améliorer la portée de l'arc. Tantôt on augmentait la longueur des branches, tantôt on améliorait leur flexibilité sans modifier leur longueur. La première expérience a engendré ce qui s'appelle aujourd'hui l'arc long. 

PARAMÈTRES : 

Capacités d'équipement : 
- Classe d'armure : +20
- Jets de toucher : +30
- Attaque par round : Passe à 4 et demi
- Multiplicateur d'attaque sournoise : -2
- Résistance à la magie : +100 %
- Hâte améliorée

Capacités de combat : 
- Ne nécessite pas de munitions
- Inflige 1d8 points de dégâts de feu à la cible

Enchantement : +4
TAC0 : +4

GOLSTONE
Anneau
Un anneau est une fine lanière de métal précieux. Il sert en général d'ornement. Plus rarement, certains sont enchantés et permettent à quiconque les porte d'user de la magie qu'ils contiennent. Ils sont de ce fait très recherchés par les aventuriers.

PARAMÈTRES :

Poids : 0

- Immunité au sort Injonction
- Immunité au sort Domination psionique
- Immunité au sort Domination
- Immunité au sort Coup de fouet à l'ego
- Immunité au sort Souffle psionique
- Immunité aux poisons
- Immunité à la folie du berserker
- Immunité aux charmes
- Immunité à l'horreur
- Immunité à la paralysie
- Immunité à l'étourdissement
- Immunité à la débilité mentale
- Immunité au sommeil
- Immunité à la confusion
- Immunité aux attaques sournoises

Type de dégâts : Contondant
Facteur de vitesse : 0
Type de compétence : Grande épée

GORCAMB
Épée à deux mains +2


Capacités d'équipement : 
- Multiplicateur d'attaque sournoise : -3

Capacités de combat : 
- 51 % de chance d'étourdir la cible pendant 3 secondes (jet de sauvegarde à -4 contre les sorts pour éviter)
- 50 % de chance de réduire de 1 la force de la cible pendant 1 tour (jet de sauvegarde à -4 contre la paralysie, la mort et les poisons pour éviter)
- 50 % de chance de réduire de 1 la dextérité de la cible pendant 1 tour (jet de sauvegarde à -4 contre la paralysie, la mort et les poisons pour éviter)
- 50 % de chance de réduire de 1 la constitution de la cible pendant 1 tour (jet de sauvegarde à -4 contre la paralysie, la mort et les poisons pour éviter)
- 50 % de chance de réduire de 5 % la rsistance  la magie de la cible pendant 5 secondes

Enchantement : +5
TAC0 : +4
Dégâts : 2d6 +4
Type de dégâts : Tranchant
Facteur de vitesse : 10
Type de compétence : Épée à deux mains

GORCHR

- Régénère 1 point de vie par seconde

GORFIRG
Anneau
Un anneau est une fine lanière de métal précieux. Il sert en général d'ornement. Plus rarement, certains sont enchantés et permettent à quiconque les porte d'user de la magie qu'ils contiennent. Ils sont de ce fait très recherchés par les aventuriers.

PARAMÈTRES :

Poids : 0

Fléau d'armes drow + 3

- Multiplicateur d'attaque sournoise : -3

Capacités de combat : 
- Inflige 5 points de dégâts magiques à la cible
- 51 % de chance d'infliger lenteur à la cible pendant 5 rounds (jet de sauvegarde à -4 contre les sorts pour éviter)
- 50 % de chance d'aveugler la cible pendant 5 rounds (jet de sauvegarde à -4 contre la paralysie, la mort et les poisons pour éviter)

TAC0 : +4
Dégâts : 2d4 +3

Type de compétence : Flail
Type : Arme à 1 main

Poids : 15

Nécessite : 
- Force : 13
HALB01
Halberd
By far the oldest and most often used polearm, the halberd consists of a cleaver-like axe blade mounted on a staff averaging six feet in length. The axe blade is balanced at the rear with a fluke and surmounted by a sharp spike, usually of quadrangular design. The fluke is sometimes replaced by a hook used to dismount cavalry. A halberd can be best described as a cross between a spear and an axe.

STATISTICS:

Damage: 1d10 (piercing)
Speed Factor: 8
Proficiency Type: Halberd
Type: Two-handed
Requires:
 13 Strength

Weight: 12
By far the oldest and most often used polearm, the halberd consists of a cleaver-like axe blade mounted on a staff averaging six feet in length. The axe blade is balanced at the rear with a fluke and surmounted by a sharp spike, usually of quadrangular design. The fluke is sometimes replaced by a hook used to dismount cavalry. A halberd can be best described as a cross between a spear and an axe.

PARAMÈTRES : 

Capacités d'équipement : 
- Multiplicateur d'attaque sournoise : -3

Dégâts : 1d10 
Type de dégâts : Perforant
Facteur de vitesse : 8
Type de compétence : Hallebarde
Type : Arme à 2 mains

Poids : 12

Nécessite : 
- Force : 13
HALB02
Halberd +1
By far the oldest and most often used polearm, the halberd consists of a cleaver-like axe blade mounted on a staff averaging six feet in length. The axe blade is balanced at the rear with a fluke and surmounted by a sharp spike, usually of quadrangular design. The fluke is sometimes replaced by a hook used to dismount cavalry. A halberd can be best described as a cross between a spear and an axe. This halberd is particularly good at its job, as it has been enchanted with a few magical properties.

STATISTICS:

THAC0: +1
Damage: 1d10+1 (piercing)
Speed Factor: 8
Proficiency Type: Halberd
Type: Two-handed
Requires:
 13 Strength

Weight: 12
By far the oldest and most often used polearm, the halberd consists of a cleaver-like axe blade mounted on a staff averaging six feet in length. The axe blade is balanced at the rear with a fluke and surmounted by a sharp spike, usually of quadrangular design. The fluke is sometimes replaced by a hook used to dismount cavalry. A halberd can be best described as a cross between a spear and an axe. This halberd is particularly good at its job, as it has been enchanted with a few magical properties.

PARAMÈTRES : 

Capacités d'équipement : 
- Multiplicateur d'attaque sournoise : -3

Enchantement : +1
TAC0 : +1
Dégâts : 1d10 +1
Type de dégâts : Perforant
Facteur de vitesse : 8
Type de compétence : Hallebarde
Type : Arme à 2 mains

Poids : 12

Nécessite : 
- Force : 13
HALB03
Suryris's Blade +2
Suryris, a white minotaur who traveled the Orsraun mountains in Turmish, lived for nothing but the thrill of combat, and encouraged warriors to challenge him for his magical weapon: a powerful halberd. Despite his aggressive nature, he was an honorable combatant and never slew opponents he could overpower. Suryris met his superior only once, in a battle that lasted hours and had the minotaur often fearing defeat. The contest ended when his opponent's sword broke, but Suryris knew he likely would have been bested had it continued. He presented his weapon to the astonished man, who thereafter told of this noble creature to anyone who would listen.

STATISTICS:

Combat abilities:
– Slashing: target suffers 1d4 slashing damage
– Staggering: target suffers -1/2 to APR and -2 to movement and casting speed for 1 round (save vs. Breath negates)

Damage: 1d10+2
THAC0: +2 (piercing)
Speed Factor: 8
Proficiency Type: Halberd
Type: Two-handed
Requires:
 13 Strength

Weight: 12
Suryris, a white minotaur who traveled the Orsraun mountains in Turmish, lived for nothing but the thrill of combat, and encouraged warriors to challenge him for his magical weapon: a powerful halberd. Despite his aggressive nature, he was an honorable combatant and never slew opponents he could overpower. Suryris met his superior only once, in a battle that lasted hours and had the minotaur often fearing defeat. The contest ended when his opponent's sword broke, but Suryris knew he likely would have been bested had it continued. He presented his weapon to the astonished man, who thereafter told of this noble creature to anyone who would listen.

PARAMÈTRES : 

Capacités d'équipement : 
- Multiplicateur d'attaque sournoise : -3

Capacités de combat : 
- Inflige 1d4 points de dégâts tranchants à la cible

Enchantement : +2
TAC0 : +2
Dégâts : 1d10 +2
Type de dégâts : Perforant
Facteur de vitesse : 8
Type de compétence : Hallebarde
Type : Arme à 2 mains

Poids : 12

Nécessite : 
- Force : 13
HALB04
Wyrmcleaver +3
This was the weapon of Thorvin Dukal, one of seven self-proclaimed Dragonslayers who spent years railing against what they called "an insidious dragon infestation that threatens Faerûn." Thorvin had this weapon enchanted at great expense and used it on many occasions, though only a single dragon has fallen to it. The Dragonslayers met their match in a cantankerous ancient red who slew the entire group in an epic battle. This weapon did not end up in the beast's hoard, however, since the creature returned to its lair to recuperate; when it emerged, the field of combat was well scavenged.

NOTE: Wyrmcleaver is always considered to be of +3 enchantment when determining what it can hit.

STATISTICS:

Combat abilities:
– Dragon Bane: +3 to THAC0 and +5 to damage against dragons
– Very Keen: +10% chance to score critical hits
– Cleaving: 33% chance upon each successful hit of gaining an extra attack per round in the next round

THAC0: +1
Damage: 1d10+1 (piercing)
Speed Factor: 8
Proficiency Type: Halberd
Type: Two-handed
Requires:
 13 Strength

Weight: 12
This was the weapon of Thorvin Dukal, one of seven self-proclaimed Dragonslayers who spent years railing against what they called "an insidious dragon infestation that threatens Faerûn." Thorvin had this weapon enchanted at great expense and used it on many occasions, though only a single dragon has fallen to it. The Dragonslayers met their match in a cantankerous ancient red who slew the entire group in an epic battle. This weapon did not end up in the beast's hoard, however, since the creature returned to its lair to recuperate; when it emerged, the field of combat was well scavenged.

NOTE: Wyrmcleaver is always considered to be of +3 enchantment when determining what it can hit.

PARAMÈTRES : 

Capacités d'équipement : 
- TAC0 : +3 contre les dragons
- Inflige 5 points de dégâts contre les dragons
- Chance de coup critique : +10 %
- Multiplicateur d'attaque sournoise : -3

Capacités de combat : 
- 33 % de chance de modifier l'attaque par round du porteur de +1 pendant 1 round

Enchantement : +3
TAC0 : +1
Dégâts : 1d10 +1
Type de dégâts : Perforant
Facteur de vitesse : 8
Type de compétence : Hallebarde
Type : Arme à 2 mains

Poids : 12

Nécessite : 
- Force : 13
HALB05
Dragon's Breath +3
Trying to profit from the strength of greater beings, many years ago the mage Ullion founded a dragon-worshipping cult under the moniker "Son of Drago." Attracting followers with promises of conquest, he sought to secure his authority by enchanting this symbolic weapon for his bodyguard, Jaramor Bold. When the Dragon's Breath strikes an opponent, it releases the harsh flames of a red dragon, the poisonous vapor of the green dragon, the blue dragon's lightning bolt, a spray of a black dragon's acid, and the white dragon's penetrating cold. Unfortunately, Ullion was the first to feel its effects, slain by the ambitious Jaramor, who sought to rule. There was no real power to be had without the mage, so the entire organization soon collapsed on itself.

STATISTICS:

Combat abilities:
– Dragon's Breath: deals 1d10 of either fire, cold, electrical, acid, or poison damage

THAC0: +3
Damage: 1d10+3 (piercing)
Speed Factor: 8
Proficiency Type: Halberd
Type: Two-handed
Requires:
 13 Strength

Weight: 12
Trying to profit from the strength of greater beings, many years ago the mage Ullion founded a dragon-worshipping cult under the moniker "Son of Drago." Attracting followers with promises of conquest, he sought to secure his authority by enchanting this symbolic weapon for his bodyguard, Jaramor Bold. When the Dragon's Breath strikes an opponent, it releases the harsh flames of a red dragon, the poisonous vapor of the green dragon, the blue dragon's lightning bolt, a spray of a black dragon's acid, and the white dragon's penetrating cold. Unfortunately, Ullion was the first to feel its effects, slain by the ambitious Jaramor, who sought to rule. There was no real power to be had without the mage, so the entire organization soon collapsed on itself.

PARAMÈTRES : 

Capacités d'équipement : 
- Multiplicateur d'attaque sournoise : -3

Capacités de combat : 
- 21 % de chance d'infliger 1d10 points de dégâts de poison à la cible
- 20 % de chance d'infliger 1d10 points de dégâts de feu à la cible
- 20 % de chance d'infliger 1d10 points de dégâts d'électricité à la cible
- 20 % de chance d'infliger 1d10 points de dégâts de froid à la cible
- 20 % de chance d'infliger 1d10 points de dégâts d'acide à la cible

Enchantement : +3
TAC0 : +3
Dégâts : 1d10 +3
Type de dégâts : Perforant
Facteur de vitesse : 8
Type de compétence : Hallebarde
Type : Arme à 2 mains

Poids : 12

Nécessite : 
- Force : 13
HALB06
Blackmist +4
This was the weapon of Dominique Harl, a sightless paladin who frequently traveled Faerûn. When attacked, Dominique would unleash the black mist that is this halberd's namesake, blinding all within his weapon's reach. This often gave him the advantage, for he lived in darkness all his life, seeing only with the inner light of faith. Dominique eventually fell, his body found in a dark forest, slain by a creature of the night even more at home in the shadows than he.

STATISTICS:

Equipped abilities:
– Blind Fighting: wielder fights without penalties even if unable to see and cannot be backstabbed

Combat abilities:
– Weakening: target suffers cumulative -1 to THAC0 and damage for 2 rounds
– Blackmist: 15% chance of blinding opponents within 10 ft. for 1 turn (save vs. Spell at -2 negates)

THAC0: +4
Damage: 1d10+4 (piercing)
Speed Factor: 8
Proficiency Type: Halberd
Type: Two-handed
Requires:
 13 Strength

Weight: 12
This was the weapon of Dominique Harl, a sightless paladin who frequently traveled Faerûn. When attacked, Dominique would unleash the black mist that is this halberd's namesake, blinding all within his weapon's reach. This often gave him the advantage, for he lived in darkness all his life, seeing only with the inner light of faith. Dominique eventually fell, his body found in a dark forest, slain by a creature of the night even more at home in the shadows than he.

- Multiplicateur d'attaque sournoise : -3
- Immunité au sort Mot de pouvoir : Cécité
- Immunité au sort Cécité
- Immunité à l'aveuglement
- Immunité aux attaques sournoises

Capacités de combat : 
- 15 % de chance de lancer instantanément le sort Cécité sur le porteur

Enchantement : +4
TAC0 : +4
Dégâts : 1d10 +4
Type de dégâts : Perforant
Facteur de vitesse : 8
Type de compétence : Hallebarde
Type : Arme à 2 mains

Poids : 12

- Force : 13
HALB07
Halberd +2
By far the oldest and most often used polearm, the halberd consists of a cleaver-like axe blade mounted on a staff averaging six feet in length. The axe blade is balanced at the rear with a fluke and surmounted by a sharp spike, usually of quadrangular design. The fluke is sometimes replaced by a hook used to dismount cavalry. A halberd can be best described as a cross between a spear and an axe. This particular halberd is enchanted, gifted with an enhanced ability to slaughter foes.

STATISTICS:

THAC0: +2
Damage: 1d10+2 (piercing)
Speed Factor: 8
Proficiency Type: Halberd
Type: Two-handed
Requires:
 13 Strength

Weight: 12
By far the oldest and most often used polearm, the halberd consists of a cleaver-like axe blade mounted on a staff averaging six feet in length. The axe blade is balanced at the rear with a fluke and surmounted by a sharp spike, usually of quadrangular design. The fluke is sometimes replaced by a hook used to dismount cavalry. A halberd can be best described as a cross between a spear and an axe. This particular halberd is enchanted, gifted with an enhanced ability to slaughter foes.

PARAMÈTRES : 

Capacités d'équipement : 
- Multiplicateur d'attaque sournoise : -3

- Force : 13
HALB08
Duskblade +2
Though once a simple halberd, this weapon spent many hundreds of years in a tomb next to the soul phylactery of a powerful lich. The creature was eventually erased from existence, purportedly by another of its kind, but such close proximity to that concentrated evil has imbued this blade with the very essence of night and the chill of darkness, energy that becomes deadly in combat. It is a foul weapon, and a warrior should use it with caution.

STATISTICS:

Combat abilities:
– Creeping Cold: target suffers 1 cold damage every round for 5 rounds

THAC0: +2
Damage: 1d10+2 (piercing)
Speed Factor: 8
Proficiency Type: Halberd
Type: Two-handed
Requires:
 13 Strength

Weight: 12
Though once a simple halberd, this weapon spent many hundreds of years in a tomb next to the soul phylactery of a powerful lich. The creature was eventually erased from existence, purportedly by another of its kind, but such close proximity to that concentrated evil has imbued this blade with the very essence of night and the chill of darkness, energy that becomes deadly in combat. It is a foul weapon, and a warrior should use it with caution.

PARAMÈTRES : 

Capacités d'équipement : 
- Multiplicateur d'attaque sournoise : -3

Capacités de combat : 
- Inflige 1 points de dégâts de froid à la cible après 5 rounds
- Inflige 1 points de dégâts de froid à la cible après 4 rounds
- Inflige 1 points de dégâts de froid à la cible après 3 rounds
- Inflige 1 points de dégâts de froid à la cible après 2 rounds
- Inflige 1 points de dégâts de froid à la cible après 1 round

Enchantement : +2
TAC0 : +2
Dégâts : 1d10 +2
Type de dégâts : Perforant
Facteur de vitesse : 8
Type de compétence : Hallebarde
Type : Arme à 2 mains

Poids : 12

Nécessite : 
- Force : 13
HALB09
The Wave +4
Forged in antiquity by a cult devoted to the goddess Umberlee, this weapon of vengeance was designed to aid the cult's champion in retrieving an even more powerful holy artifact from the fire giants of the Storm Horn Mountains. That was a lot of hope to place in one champion, and unfortunately, The Wave disappeared along with them. It was eventually found by the adventurer Arganon of the Long Reach, who found it extremely useful during his planar travels, and The Wave soon became known on the Elemental Plane of Fire as "Clisirick," or "Fire Eater." Whether The Bitch Queen was hungry to retrieve the holy weapon or just took pleasure in unleashing her wrath, Arganon's ship was sunk during a great storm in the Sea of Swords and The Wave has been lost ever since.

STATISTICS:

Equipped abilities:
– Spell Immunity: Horrid Wilting

Combat abilities:
– Smashing Wave: 15% chance target and opponents within 5 ft. suffer 5d4 crushing damage and are knocked unconscious for 1 round (save vs. Breath at -2 neg. unconsciousness)
– Fire Eating: efreeti, fire elementals, fire giants, and fire salamanders struck by the Smashing Wave die (save vs. Death at -2 negates)

THAC0: +4
Damage: 1d10+4 (piercing)
Speed Factor: 8
Proficiency Type: Halberd
Type: Two-handed
Requires:
 13 Strength

Weight: 12
Forged in antiquity by a cult devoted to the goddess Umberlee, this weapon of vengeance was designed to aid the cult's champion in retrieving an even more powerful holy artifact from the fire giants of the Storm Horn Mountains. That was a lot of hope to place in one champion, and unfortunately, The Wave disappeared along with them. It was eventually found by the adventurer Arganon of the Long Reach, who found it extremely useful during his planar travels, and The Wave soon became known on the Elemental Plane of Fire as "Clisirick," or "Fire Eater." Whether The Bitch Queen was hungry to retrieve the holy weapon or just took pleasure in unleashing her wrath, Arganon's ship was sunk during a great storm in the Sea of Swords and The Wave has been lost ever since.

PARAMÈTRES : 

Capacités d'équipement : 
- Multiplicateur d'attaque sournoise : -3
- Immunité au sort Flétrissure abominable d'Abi-Dalzim

Enchantement : +4
TAC0 : +4
Dégâts : 1d10 +4
Type de dégâts : Perforant
Facteur de vitesse : 8
Type de compétence : Hallebarde
Type : Arme à 2 mains

Poids : 12

Nécessite : 
- Force : 13
HALB10
Ravager +4
The guards upon the walls of the evil fortress, Darkhold, carry halberds of ancient, demonic creation. The halberds were purchased from the forges of hell in trade for the souls of captured heroes, so each halberd is a valued possession. Those who wield these weapons outside the walls of Darkhold do so at their own peril, for the master of the hold is said to be linked to each one. Only taking the blood-soaked shaft of this weapon in hand brings a sudden chill along the spine and the very sight of this cursed halberd has been known to strike terror into the heart of an opponent.

STATISTICS:

Combat abilities:
– Poisonous: target suffers 1d6 poison damage
– Dooming: target suffers -1 to THAC0, damage, and Saving Throws for 5 rounds (save vs. Spell negates)
– Terrifying Aura: opponents within 5 ft. are frozen in terror (save vs. Spell at -2 negates)

THAC0: +4
Damage: 1d10+4 (piercing)
Speed Factor: 8
Proficiency Type: Halberd
Type: Two-handed
Requires:
 13 Strength

Weight: 12
The guards upon the walls of the evil fortress, Darkhold, carry halberds of ancient, demonic creation. The halberds were purchased from the forges of hell in trade for the souls of captured heroes, so each halberd is a valued possession. Those who wield these weapons outside the walls of Darkhold do so at their own peril, for the master of the hold is said to be linked to each one. Only taking the blood-soaked shaft of this weapon in hand brings a sudden chill along the spine and the very sight of this cursed halberd has been known to strike terror into the heart of an opponent.

Capacités d'équipement : 
- Multiplicateur d'attaque sournoise : -3

Capacités de combat : 
- Inflige 1d6 points de dégâts de poison à la cible
- Réduit les jets de sauvegarde, le TAC0 et les dégâts de la cible de 1 pendant 4 rounds (jet de sauvegarde contre les sorts pour éviter)

Enchantement : +4
TAC0 : +4
Dégâts : 1d10 +4
Type de dégâts : Perforant
Facteur de vitesse : 8
Type de compétence : Hallebarde
Type : Arme à 2 mains

HALB11
Ravager +5
The guards upon the walls of the evil fortress, Darkhold, carry halberds of ancient, demonic creation. The halberds were purchased from the forges of hell in trade for the souls of captured heroes, so each halberd is a valued possession. Those who wield these weapons outside the walls of Darkhold do so at their own peril, for the master of the hold is said to be linked to each one. Only taking the blood-soaked shaft of this weapon in hand brings a sudden chill along the spine and the very sight of this cursed halberd has been known to strike terror into the heart of an opponent.

Combined with the Serpent Shaft, this dark halberd has the ability to slay an opponent with a single blow—unless they can survive its lethal poison.

STATISTICS:

Combat abilities:
– Poisonous: target suffers 1d8 poison damage
– Dooming: target suffers -1 to THAC0, damage, and Saving Throws for 5 rounds (save vs. Spell negates)
– Terrifying Aura: opponents within 5 ft. are frozen in terror (save vs. Spell at -2 negates)
– Viperous: 15% chance target suffers 5 poison damage every second for 2 rounds (save vs. Poison at -4 negates)

THAC0: +5
Damage: 1d10+5 (piercing)
Speed Factor: 8
Proficiency Type: Halberd
Type: Two-handed
Requires:
 13 Strength

Weight: 12
The guards upon the walls of the evil fortress, Darkhold, carry halberds of ancient, demonic creation. The halberds were purchased from the forges of hell in trade for the souls of captured heroes, so each halberd is a valued possession. Those who wield these weapons outside the walls of Darkhold do so at their own peril, for the master of the hold is said to be linked to each one. Only taking the blood-soaked shaft of this weapon in hand brings a sudden chill along the spine and the very sight of this cursed halberd has been known to strike terror into the heart of an opponent.

Combined with the Serpent Shaft, this dark halberd has the ability to slay an opponent with a single blow—unless they can survive its lethal poison.

PARAMÈTRES : 

Capacités d'équipement : 
- Multiplicateur d'attaque sournoise : -3

Capacités de combat : 
- Inflige 1d8 points de dégâts de poison à la cible
- Réduit les jets de sauvegarde, le TAC0 et les dégâts de la cible de 1 pendant 4 rounds (jet de sauvegarde contre les sorts pour éviter)

Enchantement : +5
TAC0 : +5
Dégâts : 1d10 +5
Type de dégâts : Perforant
Facteur de vitesse : 8
Type de compétence : Hallebarde
Type : Arme à 2 mains

Poids : 10

Nécessite : 
- Force : 13
HALB12
Halberd +3
By far the oldest and most often used polearm, the halberd consists of a cleaver-like axe blade mounted on a staff averaging six feet in length. The axe blade is balanced at the rear with a fluke and surmounted by a sharp spike, usually of quadrangular design. The fluke is sometimes replaced by a hook used to dismount cavalry. A halberd can be best described as a cross between a spear and an axe. This particular halberd is enchanted, gifted with an enhanced ability to slaughter foes.

STATISTICS:

THAC0: +3
Damage: 1d10+3 (piercing)
Speed Factor: 8
Proficiency Type: Halberd
Type: Two-handed
Requires:
 13 Strength

Weight: 12
By far the oldest and most often used polearm, the halberd consists of a cleaver-like axe blade mounted on a staff averaging six feet in length. The axe blade is balanced at the rear with a fluke and surmounted by a sharp spike, usually of quadrangular design. The fluke is sometimes replaced by a hook used to dismount cavalry. A halberd can be best described as a cross between a spear and an axe. This particular halberd is enchanted, gifted with an enhanced ability to slaughter foes.

- Multiplicateur d'attaque sournoise : -3

Poids : 12

HALB13
The Chesley Crusher +2
Heavy Halberd
First wielded by the much-maligned Ensign Chesley of the first exploratory fleet of Waterdeep, this famous halberd has been passed around for generations, but only to those strong enough to carry its considerable weight. The iron haft of this heavy polearm makes the weapon slow and unwieldy, but its sheer mass smashes skulls and shatters limbs.

STATISTICS:

Combat abilities:
– Powerful Weapon: +2 to damage
– Unwieldy: -1/2 Attack per Round

THAC0: +2
Damage: 1d10+2 (piercing)
Speed Factor: 8
Proficiency Type: Halberd
Type: Two-handed
Requires:
 16 Strength

Weight: 14
Heavy Halberd

The iron haft of this heavy polearm makes the weapon slow and unwieldy, but its sheer mass smashes skulls and shatters limbs.

- Attaque par round : 0
- Multiplicateur d'attaque sournoise : -3

HALBRD01
Hallebarde


Capacités d'équipement : 
- Multiplicateur d'attaque sournoise : -3

Dégâts : 1d10 
Type de dégâts : Perforant
Facteur de vitesse : 8
Type de compétence : Grande épée

Poids : 15

Nécessite :

HALBSHA
Lame de Suryris +2
Faite d'une lame de hache en couperet montée sur un bâton d'environ 1,8 m, la hallebarde est l'arme d'hast la plus ancienne et la plus utilisée. C'est un croisement entre une lance et une hache. On a forgé cette arme-ci avec de la magie, ce qui lui permet de massacrer vos adversaires plus efficacement.

PARAMÈTRES :

TAC0 : +2
Dégâts : 1d10+2 (perforant)
Facteur de vitesse : 7
Type de compétence : hallebarde
Type : arme à deux mains
Nécessite : 13 en Force

Poids : 12
Faite d'une lame de hache en couperet montée sur un bâton d'environ 1,8 m, la hallebarde est l'arme d'hast la plus ancienne et la plus utilisée. C'est un croisement entre une lance et une hache. On a forgé cette arme-ci avec de la magie, ce qui lui permet de massacrer vos adversaires plus efficacement.

Poids : 12

- Force : 11
HAMM01
War Hammer
Mounted knights cannot effectively use long pole weapons while on horseback, and as a result, many weapons have been fitted with shorter shafts so they may be wielded with just one hand. Maces and flails are two previous examples of this—the war hammer is another. The horseman's war hammer is a descendent of the Lucerne hammer. It is made entirely of steel, with rondels protecting and strengthening the grip. Rondels are small disks of metal, often shaped into decorative designs. The shaft is about 18 inches long.

STATISTICS:

Damage: 1d4+1 (crushing)
Speed Factor: 5
Proficiency Type: War Hammer
Type: One-handed
Requires:
 10 Strength

Weight: 5
Mounted knights cannot effectively use long pole weapons while on horseback, and as a result, many weapons have been fitted with shorter shafts so they may be wielded with just one hand. Maces and flails are two previous examples of this—the war hammer is another. The horseman's war hammer is a descendent of the Lucerne hammer. It is made entirely of steel, with rondels protecting and strengthening the grip. Rondels are small disks of metal, often shaped into decorative designs. The shaft is about 18 inches long.

PARAMÈTRES : 

Capacités d'équipement : 
- Multiplicateur d'attaque sournoise : -2

Dégâts : 1d4 +1
Type de dégâts : Contondant
Facteur de vitesse : 5
Type de compétence : Marteau de guerre
Type : Arme à 1 main

Poids : 5

Nécessite : 
- Force : 10
HAMM02
War Hammer +1
Like others of its type, this war hammer is made entirely of steel, with a bone-crushing hammer mounted upon an 18" shaft. This war hammer is particularly good at its job, as it has been enchanted with a few magical properties.

STATISTICS:

THAC0: +1
Damage: 1d4+2 (crushing)
Speed Factor: 5
Proficiency Type: War Hammer
Type: One-handed
Requires:
 10 Strength

Weight: 5

HAMM03
Ashideena +2
Lady Ashideena was a remarkable strategist who honed her skills against the orc armies in the Year of the Black Horde. She met Dergat Wiltoon—the warrior that wielded this weapon—when he foiled an ambush led by the great orc Varstok, and soon after made him her Field Captain. After serving at each other's side for the entirety of the war they fell in love and eventually married. Historians report that Dergat named his war hammer after his bride to remind himself of the love he fought to protect. What Lady Ashideena thought of this is unknown.

STATISTICS:

Combat abilities:
– Shocking: target suffers 1d4 electrical damage

THAC0: +2
Damage: 1d4+3 (crushing)
Speed Factor: 5
Proficiency Type: War Hammer
Type: One-handed
Requires:
 10 Strength

Weight: 5
Lady Ashideena was a remarkable strategist who honed her skills against the orc armies in the Year of the Black Horde. She met Dergat Wiltoon—the warrior that wielded this weapon—when he foiled an ambush led by the great orc Varstok, and soon after made him her Field Captain. After serving at each other's side for the entirety of the war they fell in love and eventually married. Historians report that Dergat named his war hammer after his bride to remind himself of the love he fought to protect. What Lady Ashideena thought of this is unknown.

Type : Arme à 1 main

Poids : 5

- Force : 10
HAMM04
Hammer of Corrosion +1
The Hammer of Corrosion—or "The Defiler," as it has become known in dwarven circles—is a fearsome weapon capable of making useless even the most powerful armors in the Realms. Its deadly acid can corrode pratically everything it touches and consecutive blows can rend plate mails and natural armors apart leaving the victim defenseless. The hammer has been passed from heroes to villains alike, occasionally finding its way into non-dwarven hands.

STATISTICS:

Combat abilities:
– Acidic: target suffers 1d4 acid damage
– Corrosive: 33% chance target suffers -1 to Armor Class for 5 rounds

THAC0: +1
Damage: 1d4+2 (crushing)
Speed Factor: 5
Proficiency Type: War Hammer
Type: One-handed
Requires:
 10 Strength

Weight: 5
The Hammer of Corrosion—or "The Defiler," as it has become known in dwarven circles—is a fearsome weapon capable of making useless even the most powerful armors in the Realms. Its deadly acid can corrode pratically everything it touches and consecutive blows can rend plate mails and natural armors apart leaving the victim defenseless. The hammer has been passed from heroes to villains alike, occasionally finding its way into non-dwarven hands.

- 33 % de chance de réduire la classe d'armure de la cible de 1 pendant 2 rounds

Type : Arme à 1 main

Poids : 5

HAMM05
Tersyus +2
Wrath of Tyr
The sibling to the more powerful hammers called Ulhaeron, Mercy of Tyr, and Bythialarus, Wisdom of Tyr. All three hammers were forged together in commemoration of the ascension of the Valjevo dynasty in the kingdom of Phlan in the year 750 DR. Eventually, the three were recovered by the temple of Tyr in Waterdeep and given in turn to those warriors who ventured into the world to combat Tyr's enemies.

STATISTICS:

Combat abilities:
– Smite Evil: 15% chance against evil creatures to deal 5d6 magic damage

THAC0: +2
Damage: 1d4+3 (crushing)
Speed Factor: 5
Proficiency Type: War Hammer
Type: One-handed
Requires:
 10 Strength

Weight: 5
Wrath of Tyr
The sibling to the more powerful hammers called Ulhaeron, Mercy of Tyr, and Bythialarus, Wisdom of Tyr. HAMM06
Dwarven Thrower +2
This hammer, not to be confused with the elven-made Dwarf Thrower, may be thrown at an opponent, and the magic in the hammer draws it back to the hand of its wielder. If it hits an opponent, it does double the damage that a thrown hammer would normally do. Against giants and ogres the hammer does even more damage, due to the special hatred that dwarves hold for these races.

STATISTICS:

Combat abilities:
– Racial Enemy: +5 to damage against giants and ogres
– Dwarven Thrower: target suffers 1d4 crushing damage when thrown
– Returning: returns to the wielder's hand instantly after an attack is made

THAC0: +2
Damage: 1d4+3
Damage Type (melee): Crushing
Damage Type (thrown): Missile
Speed Factor: 5
Proficiency Type: War Hammer
Type: One-handed
Requires:
 10 Strength

Weight: 5
This hammer, not to be confused with the elven-made Dwarf Thrower, may be thrown at an opponent, and the magic in the hammer draws it back to the hand of its wielder. If it hits an opponent, it does double the damage that a thrown hammer would normally do. Against giants and ogres the hammer does even more damage, due to the special hatred that dwarves hold for these races.

PARAMÈTRES : 

Capacités d'équipement : 
- Inflige 5 points de dégâts contre les orcs
- Inflige 5 points de dégâts contre les géants
- Multiplicateur d'attaque sournoise : -2

Capacités de combat : 
- Revient dans la main du lanceur
- Inflige 1d4 points de dégâts contondants à la cible

HAMM07
Hammer of Thunderbolts +3
A dwarven smith, Silverblade, forged this hammer and two other items: a Girdle of Giant Strength and a Gauntlets of Ogre Power. His intention was to gift them to his son, who was then a high officer in the dwarven armies, fighting the giant and ogre tribes of the area. Unfortunately, Silverblade's son died just after the completion of the three items, and before they could be gifted to him. In his grief, Silverblade himself donned the girdle and the gauntlets. Taking up the Hammer of Thunderbolts, he went to battle against the giant folk, and died valiantly.

STATISTICS:

Combat abilities:
– Shocking: target suffers 1d6 electrical damage

THAC0: +3
Damage: 1d4+4 (crushing)
Speed Factor: 5
Proficiency Type: War Hammer
Type: One-handed
Requires:
 10 Strength

Weight: 5
A dwarven smith, Silverblade, forged this hammer and two other items: a Girdle of Giant Strength and a Gauntlets of Ogre Power. His intention was to gift them to his son, who was then a high officer in the dwarven armies, fighting the giant and ogre tribes of the area. Unfortunately, Silverblade's son died just after the completion of the three items, and before they could be gifted to him. In his grief, Silverblade himself donned the girdle and the gauntlets. Taking up the Hammer of Thunderbolts, he went to battle against the giant folk, and died valiantly.

PARAMÈTRES : 

Capacités d'équipement : 
- Multiplicateur d'attaque sournoise : -2

Capacités de combat : 
- Inflige 1d6 points de dégâts d'électricité à la cible

Enchantement : +3
TAC0 : +3
Dégâts : 1d4 +4
Type de dégâts : Contondant
Facteur de vitesse : 5
Type de compétence : Marteau de guerre
Type : Arme à 1 main

Poids : 5

Nécessite : 
- Force : 10
HAMM08
War Hammer +2
Mounted knights cannot effectively use long pole weapons while on horseback, and as a result, many weapons have been fitted with shorter shafts so they may be wielded with just one hand. Maces and flails are two previous examples of this—the war hammer is another. The horseman's war hammer is a descendent of the Lucerne hammer. It is made entirely of steel, with rondels protecting and strengthening the grip. Rondels are small disks of metal, often shaped into decorative designs. The shaft is about 18 inches long. Powerful magical energy flows through this weapon, though its origins are unknown.

STATISTICS:

THAC0: +2
Damage: 1d4+3 (crushing)
Speed Factor: 5
Proficiency Type: War Hammer
Type: One-handed
Requires:
 10 Strength

Weight: 5
Mounted knights cannot effectively use long pole weapons while on horseback, and as a result, many weapons have been fitted with shorter shafts so they may be wielded with just one hand. Maces and flails are two previous examples of this—the war hammer is another. The horseman's war hammer is a descendent of the Lucerne hammer. It is made entirely of steel, with rondels protecting and strengthening the grip. Rondels are small disks of metal, often shaped into decorative designs. The shaft is about 18 inches long. Powerful magical energy flows through this weapon, though its origins are unknown.

PARAMÈTRES : 

Capacités d'équipement : 
- Multiplicateur d'attaque sournoise : -2

Enchantement : +2
TAC0 : +2
Dégâts : 1d4 +3
Type de dégâts : Contondant
Facteur de vitesse : 5
Type de compétence : Marteau de guerre
Type : Arme à 1 main

Poids : 5

Nécessite : 
- Force : 10
HAMM09
Crom Faeyr +4
A dwarven smith, Silverblade, forged this hammer and two other items: a Girdle of Giant Strength and a Gauntlets of Ogre Power. His intention was to gift them to his son, who was then a high officer in the dwarven armies, fighting the giant and ogre tribes of the area. Unfortunately, Silverblade's son died just after the completion of the three items, and before they could be gifted to him. In his grief, Silverblade himself donned the girdle and the gauntlets. Taking up the Hammer of Thunderbolts, he went to battle against the giant folk, and died valiantly.

Alone, the Hammer of Thunderbolts is a powerful magical weapon, but when merged with a pair of Gauntlets of Ogre Power and a Girdle of Giant Strength, it can be used to full effect. Crom Faeyr gifts its users with all the powers of the original recipients, effectively becoming one of the most fearsome weapon in the Realms.

STATISTICS:

Equipped abilities:
– Strength: +5

Combat abilities:
– Shocking: target suffers 1d6 electrical damage
– Thunderclap: target and opponents within 5 ft. are stunned for 1 round when thrown (save vs. Breath negates)
– Returning: returns to the wielder's hand instantly after an attack is made

THAC0: +4
Damage: 1d4+5
Damage Type (melee): Crushing
Damage Type (thrown): Missile
Speed Factor: 5
Proficiency Type: War Hammer
Type: One-handed
Requires:
 10 Strength

Weight: 5
A dwarven smith, Silverblade, forged this hammer and two other items: a Girdle of Giant Strength and a Gauntlets of Ogre Power. His intention was to gift them to his son, who was then a high officer in the dwarven armies, fighting the giant and ogre tribes of the area. Unfortunately, Silverblade's son died just after the completion of the three items, and before they could be gifted to him. In his grief, Silverblade himself donned the girdle and the gauntlets. Taking up the Hammer of Thunderbolts, he went to battle against the giant folk, and died valiantly.

Alone, the Hammer of Thunderbolts is a powerful magical weapon, but when merged with a pair of Gauntlets of Ogre Power and a Girdle of Giant Strength, it can be used to full effect. Crom Faeyr gifts its users with all the powers of the original recipients, effectively becoming one of the most fearsome weapon in the Realms.

PARAMÈTRES : 

Capacités d'équipement : 
- Force : +5
- Multiplicateur d'attaque sournoise : -2

Capacités de combat (Thrown) : 
- Revient dans la main du lanceur
- Inflige 1d6 points de dégâts d'électricité à la cible
- Etourdit les adversaires dans un rayon d'1,50 mètre pendant 1 round (jet de sauvegarde contre les souffles pour éviter)

Capacités de combat (Melee) : 
- Inflige 1d6 points de dégâts d'électricité à la cible

Enchantement : +4
TAC0 : +4
Dégâts : 1d4 +5
Type de dégâts : Contondant (Melee)
Type de dégâts : Projectile (Thrown)
Facteur de vitesse : 5
Type de compétence : Marteau de guerre
Type : Arme à 1 main

Poids : 5

Nécessite : 
- Force : 10

HAMM10
Runehammer +4
Glittering with magical runes this unique specimen of runehammer has been seen a number of times throughout the Realms, always appearing where a powerful evil threat is growing. It seems to patiently wait for someone to take it up, inevitably disappearing once the threat has been eliminated. No one knows for certain where this weapon originate, though the starmetal it's made of is clearly of extraplanar origin. Perhaps it comes from the outer planes to help the righteous of Faerûn defend their home, or perhaps its arrival here is simply an accident. Regardless of its origin, it's unusually effective against creatures from other planes of existence.

STATISTICS:

Equipped abilities:
– Magic Resistance: +5%

Combat abilities:
– Starmetal: +5 to damage against extraplanar creatures
– Banishing: summoned and gated creatures are dismissed (save vs. Spell at -2 negates)

THAC0: +4
Damage: 1d4+5 (crushing)
Speed Factor: 5
Proficiency Type: War Hammer
Type: One-handed
Requires:
 10 Strength

Weight: 5
Glittering with magical runes this unique specimen of runehammer has been seen a number of times throughout the Realms, always appearing where a powerful evil threat is growing. It seems to patiently wait for someone to take it up, inevitably disappearing once the threat has been eliminated. No one knows for certain where this weapon originate, though the starmetal it's made of is clearly of extraplanar origin. Perhaps it comes from the outer planes to help the righteous of Faerûn defend their home, or perhaps its arrival here is simply an accident. Regardless of its origin, it's unusually effective against creatures from other planes of existence.

PARAMÈTRES : 

Capacités d'équipement : 
- Inflige 5 points de dégâts contre les planétaires déchus
- Inflige 5 points de dégâts contre les planétaires
- Inflige 5 points de dégâts contre les devas déchues
- Inflige 5 points de dégâts contre les devas
- Inflige 5 points de dégâts contre les tieffelins
- Inflige 5 points de dégâts contre les githyankis
- Inflige 5 points de dégâts contre les génies
- Inflige 5 points de dégâts contre les élémentaires
- Inflige 5 points de dégâts contre les diablotins
- Inflige 5 points de dégâts contre les méphites
- Inflige 5 points de dégâts contre les rakshasas
- Inflige 5 points de dégâts contre les démons
- Multiplicateur d'attaque sournoise : -2
- Résistance à la magie : +5 %

Enchantement : +4
TAC0 : +4
Dégâts : 1d4 +5
Type de dégâts : Contondant
Facteur de vitesse : 5
Type de compétence : Marteau de guerre
Type : Arme à 1 main

Poids : 5

HAMM11
Runehammer +5
Glittering with magical runes this unique specimen of runehammer has been seen a number of times throughout the Realms, always appearing where a powerful evil threat is growing. It seems to patiently wait for someone to take it up, inevitably disappearing once the threat has been eliminated. No one knows for certain where this weapon originate, though the starmetal it's made of is clearly of extraplanar origin. Perhaps it comes from the outer planes to help the righteous of Faerûn defend their home, or perhaps its arrival here is simply an accident. Regardless of its origin, it's unusually effective against creatures from other planes of existence.

The Rune of Clangeddin, the dwarven god of battle and bravery, is now inscribed on the head of this hammer, granting even greater powers to any who wield the weapon.

STATISTICS:

Special abilities:
– Mass Cure (once per day)
– Champion's Strength (once per day): +6 for 1 turn

Equipped abilities:
– Magic Resistance: +10%
– Protects Against: Fear

Combat abilities:
– Starmetal: +5 to damage against extraplanar creatures
– Banishing: summoned and gated creatures are dismissed (save vs. Spell at -2 negates)

THAC0: +5
Damage: 1d4+6 (crushing)
Speed Factor: 5
Proficiency Type: War Hammer
Type: One-handed
Requires:
 10 Strength

Weight: 5
Glittering with magical runes this unique specimen of runehammer has been seen a number of times throughout the Realms, always appearing where a powerful evil threat is growing. It seems to patiently wait for someone to take it up, inevitably disappearing once the threat has been eliminated. No one knows for certain where this weapon originate, though the starmetal it's made of is clearly of extraplanar origin. Perhaps it comes from the outer planes to help the righteous of Faerûn defend their home, or perhaps its arrival here is simply an accident. Regardless of its origin, it's unusually effective against creatures from other planes of existence.

The Rune of Clangeddin, the dwarven god of battle and bravery, is now inscribed on the head of this hammer, granting even greater powers to any who wield the weapon.

- Inflige 5 points de dégâts contre les planétaires déchus

- Inflige 5 points de dégâts contre les devas déchues
- Inflige 5 points de dégâts contre les devas

- Inflige 5 points de dégâts contre les méphites
- Inflige 5 points de dégâts contre les rakshasas
- Inflige 5 points de dégâts contre les démons
- Multiplicateur d'attaque sournoise : -2
- Résistance à la magie : +10 %
- Le moral du porteur reste au plus haut
- Immunité à l'horreur
- Immunité à la peur
- Immunité à la panique

- Mass Cure (1 fois par jour)
- Champion's Strength (1 fois par jour)

HELM01
Helmet
This class of open-faced helmet, made of reinforced leather or metal, covers most of the head, save the face and neck. These helmets commonly provide protection for the nose as well.

– Armor Class: +1

- Classe d'armure : +1

Poids : 3
HELM02
Helm of Despair
The evil form of the paladin, the blackguard, is opposite in every way. As the image of the paladin often takes the form of a knight in shining armor, so the blackguard wears the dark plate that blends with the night. Blackguard's helmets are fashioned to increase the intimidating presence of their wearer, and are blessed by evil gods.

STATISTICS:

Equipped abilities:
– Armor Class: +1
– Charisma: +1
– Spell: Bless

NOTE: Multiple Bless effects are not cumulative.

Weight: 3
The evil form of the paladin, the blackguard, is opposite in every way. As the image of the paladin often takes the form of a knight in shining armor, so the blackguard wears the dark plate that blends with the night. Blackguard's helmets are fashioned to increase the intimidating presence of their wearer, and are blessed by evil gods.

PARAMÈTRES : 

Capacités d'équipement : 
- Classe d'armure : +1
- Charisme : +1
- Bénédiction
- Immunité au sort Bénédiction

Poids : 3
HELM02_
Helm of Opposite Alignment
The cursed Helm of Alignment Change is a truly fearsome item. As its name suggests, it has the power to alter the fundamental ethical framework, nay, the very identity of anyone unlucky enough to wear it. It can ruin homes, friendships, even entire cities or nations. Should the legions of evil ever force one onto the head of a benevolent Solar, the multiverse, as we know it, will surely meet an abrupt and painful end.

STATISTICS:

*CURSED*

Equipped abilities:
– Armor Class: +1
– Reverse Alignment: wearer's alignment is set to their opposite

Weight: 3
The cursed Helm of Alignment Change is a truly fearsome item. As its name suggests, it has the power to alter the fundamental ethical framework, nay, the very identity of anyone unlucky enough to wear it. It can ruin homes, friendships, even entire cities or nations. Should the legions of evil ever force one onto the head of a benevolent Solar, the multiverse, as we know it, will surely meet an abrupt and painful end.

PARAMÈTRES : 

Capacités d'équipement : 
- Maudit : Ne peut être ôté qu'à l'aide d'un sort de Délivrance de la malédiction
- Classe d'armure : +1
- Inverse l'alignement du porteur

Poids : 2
HELM03
Helm of Glory
Helm of the Noble
Named for its original owner, Sir Tain the Noble, this helm saw many great battles in his possession. It was eventually passed on to Sir Tain's squire, who had served him faithfully for almost ten years. Alas, the young man had neither the strength, nor the skill to uphold his master's legacy. It is rumored he lost his life in the pursuit of a worthy, but ultimately futile cause, and the helm has had many owners since.

STATISTICS:

Equipped abilities:
– Armor Class: +1
– Charisma: +1
– Spell: Bless

NOTE: Multiple Bless effects are not cumulative.

Weight: 3
Helm of the Noble
Named for its original owner, Sir Tain the Noble, this helm saw many great battles in his possession. It was eventually passed on to Sir Tain's squire, who had served him faithfully for almost ten years. Alas, the young man had neither the strength, nor the skill to uphold his master's legacy. It is rumored he lost his life in the pursuit of a worthy, but ultimately futile cause, and the helm has had many owners since.

PARAMÈTRES :

- Charisme : +1
- Bénédiction
- Immunité au sort Bénédiction

Poids : 3
HELM04
Helm of Defense
Gift of Peace
Prized for its noble origin as much as for its benefits to the wearer, this helm was originally intended to be a simple gift. There was no great crisis at hand, nor dangerous evil to be overthrown; just a wish for a friend to give a gift to another. It could just have easily been a good book or bottle of wine, but adventurers are eminently more practical in their gift giving. The helm has seen many great battles since its creation, but the simple virtue at its core is what has always been remembered.

STATISTICS:

Equipped abilities:
– Armor Class: +1
– Saving Throws: +1
– Protects against critical hits

Weight: 3
Gift of Peace

There was no great crisis at hand, nor dangerous evil to be overthrown; just a wish for a friend to give a gift to another. It could just have easily been a good book or bottle of wine, but adventurers are eminently more practical in their gift giving. The helm has seen many great battles since its creation, but the simple virtue at its core is what has always been remembered.

- Protection contre les coups critiques
- Classe d'armure : +1
- Jets de sauvegarde : +1

Poids : 3
HELM05
Helm of the Watcher
It is unclear if these magic headpieces were created by clerics of Helm, god of guardians, or if they acquired their name by a more convenient circumstance. Whatever the case, they are highly prized by guards and sentries. Needless to say, bandits have also taken to wearing them, proving the old proverb that "what's good for the goose is good for the gander."

STATISTICS:

Equipped abilities:
– Armor Class: +1
– Protects Against: Blindness and Deafness

Weight: 3

HELM06
Helm of Charm Protection
As its name suggests, the Helm of Charm Protection protects its wearer from any magical attempts at emotional manipulation. As a precaution, some high-profile mercenary groups regularly equip their members with such helmets to ensure that they can perform their prescribed duties without external interference.

STATISTICS:

Equipped abilities:
– Armor Class: +1
– Protects Against: Charm and Domination

Weight: 3
As its name suggests, the Helm of Charm Protection protects its wearer from any magical attempts at emotional manipulation. As a precaution, some high-profile mercenary groups regularly equip their members with such helmets to ensure that they can perform their prescribed duties without external interference.

PARAMÈTRES : 

Capacités d'équipement : 
- Classe d'armure : +1
- Immunité aux charmes

Poids : 3
HELM07
Helm of Balduran
Balduran, a legendary seafaring explorer, was the first native of Faerûn to set foot on the lands known as Anchorome, making the trek up to Sossal. He returned full of tales and vast wealth, and put forth a large sum of money to protect his sparsely-settled home harbor town. Then he set sail for Anchorome once more, not to been seen again to this day. His money was well-spent on the wall though, and that small town soon grew into the city of Baldur's Gate.

The fabled helm of Balduran has long been rumored to wield powerful protective magic. The exact nature of this magic, however, has not yet been determined.

STATISTICS:

Equipped abilities:
– Armor Class: +1
– Magic Resistance: +10%
– Maximum Hit Points: +5

Weight: 3
Balduran, a legendary seafaring explorer, was the first native of Faerûn to set foot on the lands known as Anchorome, making the trek up to Sossal. He returned full of tales and vast wealth, and put forth a large sum of money to protect his sparsely-settled home harbor town. Then he set sail for Anchorome once more, not to been seen again to this day. His money was well-spent on the wall though, and that small town soon grew into the city of Baldur's Gate.

The fabled helm of Balduran has long been rumored to wield powerful protective magic. The exact nature of this magic, however, has not yet been determined.

PARAMÈTRES : 

Capacités d'équipement : 
- Classe d'armure : +1
- Points de vie maximum : +5
- Résistance à la magie : +10 %

Poids : 3

Poids : 3
HELM16
Helm of Brilliance
This helm appears ordinary until its true nature is perceived. Made of brilliant silver and polished steel, the Helm of Brilliance is set with diamonds, rubies, fire opals, and opals, each of large size and enchanted. When struck by bright light, the helm scintillates and sends forth reflective rays in all directions from its crown-like, gem-tipped spikes. The jewels allow the wearer to cast a variety of powerful spells and can absorb significant amounts of fire damage.

The few such helms reported to still exist have been traced back to a great cleric of Lathander from Baldur's Gate named Ergelion. Ergelion equipped his companions with these helms to turn back a horde of undead swarming out of the Troll Hills to the north. Though the horde never reached Baldur's Gate, none of that band of adventurers was seen or heard from again.

STATISTICS:

Special abilities:
– Fireball (once per day)
– Prismatic Spray (once per day)
– False Dawn (once per day)

Equipped abilities:
– Armor Class: +1
– Fire Resistance: +50%

Weight: 3
This helm appears ordinary until its true nature is perceived. Made of brilliant silver and polished steel, the Helm of Brilliance is set with diamonds, rubies, fire opals, and opals, each of large size and enchanted. When struck by bright light, the helm scintillates and sends forth reflective rays in all directions from its crown-like, gem-tipped spikes. The jewels allow the wearer to cast a variety of powerful spells and can absorb significant amounts of fire damage.

The few such helms reported to still exist have been traced back to a great cleric of Lathander from Baldur's Gate named Ergelion. Ergelion equipped his companions with these helms to turn back a horde of undead swarming out of the Troll Hills to the north. Though the horde never reached Baldur's Gate, none of that band of adventurers was seen or heard from again.

PARAMÈTRES : 

Capacités d'équipement : 
- Classe d'armure : +1
- Résistance au feu : +50 %

Capacités de charge : 
- Fireball (1 fois par jour)
- Prismatic Spray (1 fois par jour)
- False Dawn (1 fois par jour)

Poids : 3
HELM17
Skull of Death
The mad necromancer lich N'Ashtar Nikadeemus forged this helmet from the bones of his own parents. His highest ranked general would wear it when he rode into battle, using it to instantly slay the commanders of the opposing army. After that, the skeletal armies of N'Ashtar would overrun their demoralized enemies. When N'Ashtar finally fell, the Skull of Death was supposedly destroyed.

STATISTICS:

Special abilities:
– Gaze of Death (once per day): target must die (save vs. Death at -2 negates)

Equipped abilities:
– Armor Class: +1
– Spell: Death Ward

Weight: 3
The mad necromancer lich N'Ashtar Nikadeemus forged this helmet from the bones of his own parents. His highest ranked general would wear it when he rode into battle, using it to instantly slay the commanders of the opposing army. After that, the skeletal armies of N'Ashtar would overrun their demoralized enemies. When N'Ashtar finally fell, the Skull of Death was supposedly destroyed.

PARAMÈTRES : 

Capacités d'équipement : 
- Classe d'armure : +1
- Immunité au sort Désintégration
- Immunité à la désintégration
- Immunité à la mort magique

Capacités de charge : 
- Gaze of Death (1 fois par jour)

Poids : 3
HELM18
Pearly White Ioun Stone
Legends tell that this particular type of ioun stone is crafted with the enslaved soul of a troll. This pearly white ioun stone will grant the wearer regeneration as well as the ability to shapeshift into a giant troll.

Although the dark rites bind the troll's regenerative properties into this stone, a dose of their weaknesses are included as well.

STATISTICS:

Special abilities:
– Shapeshifts Troll (once per day): 5 turns

Troll (7 HD):
 STR 18, DEX 16, CON 20
 AC 4, THAC0 12, APR 3
 1d6 Piercing (Claws +2)
 SR 0%, CR 0%, PR 0%, MR 0%
 FR 0%, CR 0%, ER 0%, AR 0%

Special Characteristics:
– Regeneration: 1 HP/second
– Mind Shield: conferred protection against many forms of mind-affecting magic, such as charm, command, confusion, emotion, domination, fear, feeblemind, hold, sleep, stun, psionics, and other similar effects

Equipped abilities:
– Regeneration: 1 HP/round
– Fire Resistance: -25%
– Acid Resistance: -25%

Weight: 0

Although the dark rites bind the troll's regenerative properties into this stone, a dose of their weaknesses are included as well.

HELM20
Trueblood's Ioun Stone
On his deathbed, aged hero Rigar Trueblood begged one last request of his mage companion Spectorial: that his skill and fortitude as a warrior live on. The reluctant friend consented and transferred these traits to an item, knowing the warrior's soul would then be lacking them. This deep red ioun stone now holds these essences, and grants the owner Trueblood's health and skill.

STATISTICS:

Equipped abilities:
– THAC0: +1
– Maximum Hit Points: +10%

Weight: 0
On his deathbed, aged hero Rigar Trueblood begged one last request of his mage companion Spectorial: that his skill and fortitude as a warrior live on. This deep red ioun stone now holds these essences, and grants the owner Trueblood's health and skill.

- Jets de toucher : +1

HELM21
Red Dragonscale Helm
The skillful hand of the warlock Wormsor carefully worked several dragon scales into this powerful helmet. The overlapping red scales protects the wearer from normal blows as well as fire damage, and donning the helmet also grants immunity to magical sleep and unconsciousness, though it is hard to determine whether these benefits originate within the scales or the spells of the mage.

STATISTICS:

– Armor Class: +1
– Fire Resistance: +25%
– Protects Against: Sleep and Unconsciousness

Though there is little contained in historical documents to verify such a golden age, the occasional discovery of one of these Thieves' Hoods is enough to keep the tale in circulation.

HELM30
Master Thief's Hood
Bards and rogues alike are known to reminisce on "the glory days," and the stories of an ancient guild so magnificient it outfitted even its lowliest members with the most incredibly wondrous wares. Though there is little contained in historical documents to verify such a golden age, the occasional discovery of one of these Thieves' Hoods is enough to keep the tale in circulation.

Combined with the power of the Ring of Invisibility, the Thieves' Hood has been imbued with magical properties to protect the wearer from their own ilk.

STATISTICS:

Special abilities:
– Shadow Door (once per day): 1 turn

Equipped abilities:
– Armor Class: +1 boonus
– Spell: Non-Detection
– Protects Against: Poison

Weight: 1

HELM31
Helm of the Rock
While most barbarians of the Tuigan tribes go to war wearing fur caps or helms taken from the enemy dead, a few select war leaders wear enchanted helms such as this one. In addition to the protection they provide the Tuigan leaders, the helms are useful for inspiring a sense of fear—not only in the people they seek to conquer, but also in their own warriors.

This helm grants a warrior immunities far beyond mere physical protections. It is obvious there once used to be a set of horns protruding from the metal cap, though the horns and any magic associated with them have long since disappeared.

STATISTICS:

Equipped abilities:
– Armor Class: +1
– Damage Resistance: +5%

Weight: 3

HELM32
Horned Helm of the Rock
While most barbarians of the Tuigan tribes go to war wearing fur caps or helms taken from the enemy dead, a few select war leaders wear enchanted helms such as this one. In addition to the protection they provide the Tuigan leaders, the helms are useful for inspiring a sense of fear—not only in the people they seek to conquer, but also in their own warriors.

With the addition of the horns, the Helm of the Rock is even more powerful. Generals and military leaders can command both fear and respect simply by wearing this helm.

STATISTICS:

Special abilities:
– Gaze of Despair (three times per day): target is paralyzed with fear for 5 rounds (save vs. Spell at -2 negates)

– Armor Class: +1
– Damage Resistance: +10%

HELM34
Wong Fei's Ioun Stone
This Ioun Stone was said to be a gift given to the Shou-ling monk, Wong Fei Hung, by the Kara-Turan god of war, Chan Cheng. The god came down in the form of a dragon and fought Wong Fei for three days and three nights. Chan Cheng was so impressed by the monk's prowess that he bestowed the Ioun Stone upon him. The stone disappeared when Wong Fei died.

STATISTICS:

Equipped abilities:
– Armor Class: +1
– Regeneration: 1 HP/2 rounds
– Protects Against: Confusion and Feeblemindedness

Weight: 0

The stone disappeared when Wong Fei died.

HGWRA02
Robe du Bon Archimage
Cette robe de mage aux pouvoirs immenses protège son porteur contre toute forme d'attaque physique, tout en accroissant sa résistance à la magie et ses jets de sauvegarde. Étant donné la nature de ses enchantements, cette robe ne peut être portée que par les mages d'alignement bon.

Capacités d'équipement :
- Classe d'armure : 5
- Jets de sauvegarde : +1
- Résistance à la magie : +5 %

Cette robe de mage aux pouvoirs immenses protège son porteur contre toute forme d'attaque physique, tout en accroissant sa résistance à la magie et ses jets de sauvegarde. Étant donné la nature de ses enchantements, cette robe ne peut être portée que par les mages d'alignement bon.

PARAMÈTRES : 

Capacités d'équipement : 
- Jets de sauvegarde : +1
- Résistance à la magie : +5 %

Poids : 6
HLOLTH
Handmaiden's Mace +3
This mace has been crafted finely by the drow, and specially treated to survive the glare of the sun. It is made for surface raids by the subterranean race... and its black metal glistens with a dark poison that seems to be generated from within and causes incredible damage upon a successful impact.

The mace seems almost alive and warm to the touch, and slithers away from those whom it does not like... namely drow or those who are similar enough to not make a difference. In the hands of anyone else, the mace becomes mere dead weight.

STATISTICS:

Combat abilities:
– Venomous: target suffers 1 poison damage every second for 2 rounds (save vs. Poison negates)
– Webbing: 33% chance target is held for 2 rounds (save vs. Breath negates)

THAC0: +3
Damage: 2d3+3 (crushing)
Speed Factor: 6
Proficiency Type: Mace / Morning Star
Type: One-handed
Requires:
 10 Strength

Weight: 8
This mace has been crafted finely by the drow, and specially treated to survive the glare of the sun. It is made for surface raids by the subterranean race... and its black metal glistens with a dark poison that seems to be generated from within and causes incredible damage upon a successful impact.

The mace seems almost alive and warm to the touch, and slithers away from those whom it does not like... namely drow or those who are similar enough to not make a difference. In the hands of anyone else, the mace becomes mere dead weight.

PARAMÈTRES : 

Capacités d'équipement : 
- Multiplicateur d'attaque sournoise : -2

Enchantement : +3
TAC0 : +3
Dégâts : 2d3 +3
Type de dégâts : Contondant
Facteur de vitesse : 6
Type de compétence : Mace / Morning Star
Type : Arme à 1 main

Poids : 8

Nécessite : 
- Force : 10

IHAMM01
Marteau de guerre
Les cavaliers peuvent difficilement manier les armes longues. C'est pourquoi de nombreuses armes ont été munies de manches plus courts pouvant être tenus d'une seule main. La masse et le fléau d'armes sont deux exemples d'armes longues qui ont suivi cette évolution, le marteau de guerre en est un autre. Le marteau de guerre du cavalier est le descendant du marteau de Lucerne. Il est entièrement fabriqué en acier, avec des rondelles pour protéger et renforcer la prise. Les rondelles sont de petits disques métalliques, souvent en forme de motifs décoratifs. Le manche mesure environ 45 cm de long.

PARAMÈTRES :

Dégâts : 1d4 +1 (contondant)
Facteur de vitesse : 4
Type de compétence : marteau de guerre
Type : arme à une main
Nécessite : 9 en Force

Poids : 6
Les cavaliers peuvent difficilement manier les armes longues. C'est pourquoi de nombreuses armes ont été munies de manches plus courts pouvant être tenus d'une seule main. La masse et le fléau d'armes sont deux exemples d'armes longues qui ont suivi cette évolution, le marteau de guerre en est un autre. Le marteau de guerre du cavalier est le descendant du marteau de Lucerne. Il est entièrement fabriqué en acier, avec des rondelles pour protéger et renforcer la prise. Les rondelles sont de petits disques métalliques, souvent en forme de motifs décoratifs. Le manche mesure environ 45 cm de long.

Imoen's Belt
Imoen does not know when or how she acquired this belt, and despite all of her efforts and magic, it cannot be removed or unbuckled.

INNOC
Anneau
Un anneau est une fine lanière de métal précieux. Il sert en général d'ornement. Plus rarement, certains sont enchantés et permettent à quiconque les porte d'user de la magie qu'ils contiennent. Ils sont de ce fait très recherchés par les aventuriers.

PARAMÈTRES :

Poids : 0
Un anneau est une fine lanière de métal précieux. Il sert en général d'ornement. Plus rarement, certains sont enchantés et permettent à quiconque les porte d'user de la magie qu'ils contiennent. Ils sont de ce fait très recherchés par les aventuriers.

IPSION
Amulette de pierre verte
Cette amulette contient une néphrite sertie dans de l'or. Quand on l'active, elle protège son porteur de toute forme d'attaque mentale, y compris psionique (Remarque : elle n'immunise pas complètement contre les attaques psioniques).

PARAMÈTRES :

Capacités de charge :
Immunité contre le charme, la confusion, la peur, la domination, la perception extra-sensorielle, la détection d'alignements, la paralysie, l'étourdissement, les attaques psioniques, le sommeil et la débilité mentale.
Durée : 1 tour

Poids : 1
Cette amulette contient une néphrite sertie dans de l'or. Quand on l'active, elle protège son porteur de toute forme d'attaque mentale, y compris psionique (Remarque : elle n'immunise pas complètement contre les attaques psioniques).

- Le moral du porteur reste au plus haut

- Immunité à la débilité mentale

- Immunité à la paralysie
- Immunité aux effets modifiant l'intelligence
- Immunité à l'étourdissement

- Capacité 1 (50 charges, l'objet est détruit quand toutes les charges sont utilisées)
  Le moral du porteur reste au plus haut pendant 1 tour
  Le moral du porteur reste au plus haut

ISHLD02
Rondache +1
La rondache est généralement ronde et se tient à bout de bras par la poignée. Comme elle est légère comparée à l'écu, le combattant peut porter d'autres objets dans la même main, mais il ne peut pas manier ou porter une autre arme.

PARAMÈTRES :

Capacités d'équipement :
- Classe d'armure : +2
- Pas de protection contre les projectiles

Nécessite : 4 en Force

- Immunité au sort Sphère du chaos
- Immunité au sort Métamorphose d'autrui
- Immunité à l'horreur
- Immunité à la peur
- Immunité à la panique
- Immunité à la pétrification
- Immunité à la folie du berserker
- Immunité au drain de niveaux
- Immunité aux charmes
- Immunité à l'emprisonnement
- Immunité à la mort magique
- Immunité au sommeil
- Immunité à la dépétrification
- Immunité contre les démons convoqués
- Les points de vie ne peuvent passer en dessous de 1

Poids : 0
JWSUPER
Anneau d'action libre
Anneau d'action libre : « Cadeau d'Edventar »
Cet anneau fut donné à Edventar, le chasseur et écumeur de récifs, par un groupe d'elfes aquatiques, ses amis de longue date. En aidant dans sa fuite Yenandra de Dambrath, la « Reine des Pirates », Edventar leur permit en effet de survivre. Mais Yenandra est toujours crainte le long de toutes les côtes.

PARAMÈTRES :

Capacités d'équipement :
- Le porteur est immunisé contre tout ce qui, magique ou non, pourrait affecter sa mobilité, y compris les sorts de rapidité et de ralentissement.

Poids : 0
Anneau d'action libre : « Cadeau d'Edventar »
Cet anneau fut donné à Edventar, le chasseur et écumeur de récifs, par un groupe d'elfes aquatiques, ses amis de longue date. En aidant dans sa fuite Yenandra de Dambrath, la « Reine des Pirates », Edventar leur permit en effet de survivre. Mais Yenandra est toujours crainte le long de toutes les côtes.

- Points de vie maximum : +100
- Résistance à la magie : Passe à 100 %
- Hâte améliorée

- Immunité au sort Hâte

- Immunité au sort Lent

- Immunité à l'étourdissement

KEY20
Mask of King Strohm III
This is the reconstructed mask of King Strohm the third. When you place it on your face, the entire world becomes tinted with odd colors. Perhaps this mask will allow you to see something that you hadn't been able to before, but its use beyond that seems questionable.

STATISTICS:

Equipped abilities:
– Armor Class: +1

Weight: 1

KORAX01
Blood Axe +2
It was the Year of Slaughter, 1090 DR, and countless victims lay slain at the Battle of the Bones. Today the site contains layers of dry white bone, but at the time it was all blood and bile, oozing from each shattered corpse and saturating the fallen equipment. No amount of polishing has been able to restore any weapon retrieved from that dread place, or even begin to remove the taint acquired there.

STATISTICS:

Combat abilities:
– Bloodlust: with each hit, the wielder gains cumulative +1 to melee damage for 2 rounds

THAC0: +2
Damage: 2d4+2 (slashing)
Speed Factor: 6
Proficiency Type: Axe
Type: One-handed
Requires:
 10 Strength

Weight: 6
It was the Year of Slaughter, 1090 DR, and countless victims lay slain at the Battle of the Bones. LEAT04
Studded Leather Armor
Studded leather armor has little in common with normal leather armor. Instead of a hardened shell, studded leather offers hundreds of metal rivets affixed to a supple backing. The numerous studs form a flexible coat of metal that helps to turn aside slashing and cutting attacks, while the leather is little more than a means of securing the rivets in place.

STATISTICS:

Armor Class: 7
Speed Factor Penalty: +1
Physical Resistance Bonus: +5%
Arcane Casting Time Penalty: +2
Stealth Penalty: -20%
Requires:
 6 Strength

Weight: 20

- Classe d'armure : +1 contre les projectiles

LEAT06
Armor of Missile Attraction +3
This odd looking suit of studded leather cannot be removed once put on, except through magical means. While improving the protection against all melee weapons, this armor actually becomes a target for missile weapons, and hence so does its wearer. The choice is simple, deadly arrows or deadly swords.

STATISTICS:

*CURSED*

Equipped abilities:
– Missile Attraction: wearer suffers -10 to Armor Class vs. missile attacks and everyone within 10 ft. gains +4 to Armor Class vs. missile attacks

Physical Resistance Bonus: +5%
Arcane Casting Time Penalty: +2

 6 Strength

LEAT08
Shadow Armor +3
The Shadow Thieves of Amn are known to have deep pockets, and while they may employ countless gutter thugs and petty crooks, their elite core members are equipped very well indeed. Items such as Shadow Armor have occasionally been recovered from events where their involvement was suspected, though guild leaders have never confirmed or denied ownership.

Shadow Armors are powerful suits created for use by the Shadowmasters of Amn, who are at the highest levels of the Shadow Thief hierarchy. The essence of night has been woven into this dark suit so that it feels and looks like normal armor but actually encloses the wearer in a mass of twisting shadows. The resulting almost insubstantial armor does not hinder movement, adds no weight or encumbrance, nor does it prevent spellcasting.

STATISTICS:

Equipped abilities:
– Shadow Armor: grants the user a +20% bonus to Hide in Shadows and allows arcane spellcasting without penalties

Armor Class: 4

Weight: 0
The Shadow Thieves of Amn are known to have deep pockets, and while they may employ countless gutter thugs and petty crooks, their elite core members are equipped very well indeed. Items such as Shadow Armor have occasionally been recovered from events where their involvement was suspected, though guild leaders have never confirmed or denied ownership.

Shadow Armors are powerful suits created for use by the Shadowmasters of Amn, who are at the highest levels of the Shadow Thief hierarchy. The essence of night has been woven into this dark suit so that it feels and looks like normal armor but actually encloses the wearer in a mass of twisting shadows. The resulting almost insubstantial armor does not hinder movement, adds no weight or encumbrance, nor does it prevent spellcasting.

PARAMÈTRES : 

Capacités d'équipement : 
- Classe d'armure de base : 4
- Classe d'armure : -1 contre les armes contondantes
- Classe d'armure : +1 contre les projectiles
- Classe d'armure : +1 contre les armes perforantes
- Classe d'armure : +2 contre les armes tranchantes
- Facteur de vitesse : -1
- Camouflage dans l'ombre : +20 %
- Résistance aux dégâts physiques : +5 %

Poids : 0
LEAT09
Karajah's Leather Armor +3
Karajah's Life and Death
Karajah was Calimshan's champion of pit fighting for a full decade, and seemingly unbeatable. His success, or so he claimed, was due to the mobility that his light armor afforded him. He may well have been unaware of the suit's magical qualities, but his peers ignored his claims of ignorance when enchantments were discovered. The armor survived the subsequent beating, whereas Karajah did not.

STATISTICS:

Equipped abilities:
– Save vs. Breath: +3
– Dexterity: +1

Armor Class: 5
Physical Resistance Bonus: +5%
Arcane Casting Time Penalty: +1
Requires:
 4 Strength

Weight: 15
Karajah's Life and Death

LEAT10
Hide Armor
Hide armor is made from the thick skin of large animals (elephants, for example) or layers of thinner, more common leather. It is considered too cumbersome for use in advanced human cultures, but is common among more barbaric humanoids. It offers better protection than normal leather, but can be hard to maintain, often resulting in an offensive odor or shoddy appearance that prevents effective use. Thieves can wear this armor, but it has a negative effect on their abilities.

STATISTICS:

Armor Class: 6
Speed Factor Penalty: +2
Physical Resistance Bonus: +10%
Arcane Casting Time Penalty: +2
Stealth Penalty: -30%
Requires:
 6 Strength

Weight: 25
Hide armor is made from the thick skin of large animals (elephants, for example) or layers of thinner, more common leather. It is considered too cumbersome for use in advanced human cultures, but is common among more barbaric humanoids. Thieves can wear this armor, but it has a negative effect on their abilities.

- Classe d'armure : -1 contre les projectiles
- Classe d'armure : -1 contre les armes perforantes
