SHLD24
Reflection Shield +1
Thought only a decoration from some forgotten festhall, this shield languished in the backroom of a shop until a young noble purchased it as parade armor. Its dormant enchantments were discovered when a later attempt on his life was foiled as the shield deflected away each attack back at the would-be assassins. Subsequent study has linked it to Myth Rhynn, or perhaps some other ancient excavation.

STATISTICS:

Equipped abilities:
– Missile Deflection: missile weapons are harmlessly deflected

NOTE: Magically created missiles like Melf's Acid Arrows, Flame Arrows, and Melf's Minute Meteors can be deflected, while magical projectiles like Lightning Bolts, Fireballs, and Magic Missiles cannot be.

Equipped abilities:
– Armor Class: +2
– No protection against missile attacks

Requires:
 4 Strength

Weight: 4
Thought only a decoration from some forgotten festhall, this shield languished in the backroom of a shop until a young noble purchased it as parade armor. Its dormant enchantments were discovered when a later attempt on his life was foiled as the shield deflected away each attack back at the would-be assassins. Subsequent study has linked it to Myth Rhynn, or perhaps some other ancient excavation.

PARAMÈTRES : 

Capacités d'équipement : 
- Classe d'armure : -2 contre les projectiles
- Classe d'armure : +2
- Immunité contre les flèches de flamme bleue
- Immunité contre les attaques de regard
- Immunité contre les lances de jet
- Immunité contre les flèches
- Immunité contre les haches de jet
- Immunité contre les carreaux
- Immunité contre les billes
- Immunité contre les dagues de jet
- Immunité contre les flèchettes

Poids : 4

Nécessite : 
- Force : 4
SHLD24A
Bouclier de Réflexion +1
Ce bouclier, qu'on pensait n'être qu'une décoration de salle de banquet, a longtemps été oublié dans l'arrière-salle d'une boutique, jusqu'à ce qu'un jeune noble en fasse l'acquisition pour compléter une armure de parade. Les enchantements qu'il contient furent révélés lors d'une tentative d'assassinat sur la personne du jeune homme, quand le bouclier renvoya toutes les flèches sur les tireurs. Une étude montra ensuite qu'il était lié au Mythe Rynn, ou peut-être à une autre excavation antique.

PARAMÈTRES :

Capacités d'équipement :
- Classe d'armure : +2
- Aucune protection contre les projectiles
- Renvoie les projectiles vers leur lanceur

Nécessite : 4 en Force

Poids : 3
Ce bouclier, qu'on pensait n'être qu'une décoration de salle de banquet, a longtemps été oublié dans l'arrière-salle d'une boutique, jusqu'à ce qu'un jeune noble en fasse l'acquisition pour compléter une armure de parade. Les enchantements qu'il contient furent révélés lors d'une tentative d'assassinat sur la personne du jeune homme, quand le bouclier renvoya toutes les flèches sur les tireurs. Une étude montra ensuite qu'il était lié au Mythe Rynn, ou peut-être à une autre excavation antique.

- Classe d'armure : +2

- Renvoie les billes
- Renvoie les lances
- Renvoie les haches
- Renvoie les fléchettes
- Renvoie les dagues
- Renvoie les carreaux
- Renvoie les flèches

Poids : 6

Nécessite : 
- Force : 6
SHLD25
Shield of Harmony +2
Audn of the Field, Knight-Champion for the wizard Kekkim, carried this shield for most of his life. It protects the bearer from most forms of mind control, a benefit for a wizard who needed warrior allies to stay faithfully at his side. Both Kekkim and Audn have long since returned to the earth, leaving the shield to whomever might recover it from Kekkim's tower.

STATISTICS:

Equipped abilities:
– Armor Class: +3
– Protects Against: Charm, Confusion, and Domination

Arcane Casting Time Penalty: +1
Requires:
 6 Strength

Weight: 6

SHLD26
Shield of the Lost +2
This odd shield was constructed by nomads that once inhabited the forest of Mir, a group long since absorbed into "civilized" society and forgotten. Examination reveals fine weaving of animal and human hair bound together by enchantment, though how this was done is lost to time.

STATISTICS:

Equipped abilities:
– Armor Class: +4
– THAC0: -1
– Deflect Magic: one spell cast against the wearer is absorbed per turn

Arcane Casting Time Penalty: +2
Requires:
 12 Strength

Weight: 15

SHLD26A
Bouclier des Disparus +2
Cet étrange bouclier fut forgé par des nomades qui habitaient la Forêt de Mir, un peuple intégré à la société « civilisée » et oublié depuis longtemps. Un examen minutieux révèle un fin tissage de poils d'animaux et de cheveux humains liés par un enchantement, mais le secret de cette réalisation s'est dissipé dans les volutes du temps.

SHLD27
Saving Grace +3
Shields like this are first mentioned in ancient liturgies of Amaunator, in which the god's champions bear radiant shields against an infestation of undead. The shields made their first appearance in modern times in dramatic fashion, appearing miraculously at the altars of several of the deity's temples in the Year of Smoldering Spells, 1020 DR. Since that time, a number have been lost in battle, and not a few were stolen by foul creatures to prevent their use.

Once a holy artifact used by the elite sect of clerics and holy warriors called Sunmasters, part of the enchantments fled with their god's demise, but it still remain a powerful tool for any adventurer.

STATISTICS:

Equipped abilities:
– Armor Class: +5
– THAC0: -1
– Searing Light: creatures who strike the wearer in melee are blinded for 1 round, and undead creatures also suffer 2d6 magic damage (save vs. Spell neg. blindness)

Arcane Casting Time Penalty: +2
Requires:
 12 Strength

Weight: 15
Shields like this are first mentioned in ancient liturgies of Amaunator, in which the god's champions bear radiant shields against an infestation of undead. The shields made their first appearance in modern times in dramatic fashion, appearing miraculously at the altars of several of the deity's temples in the Year of Smoldering Spells, 1020 DR. Since that time, a number have been lost in battle, and not a few were stolen by foul creatures to prevent their use.

Once a holy artifact used by the elite sect of clerics and holy warriors called Sunmasters, part of the enchantments fled with their god's demise, but it still remain a powerful tool for any adventurer.

PARAMÈTRES : 

Capacités d'équipement : 
- Classe d'armure : +5
- TAC0 : -1
- Vitesse d'incantation des sorts profanes : -2
- Lorsque le porteur est attaqué ; Lance un sortilège

Poids : 15

Nécessite : 
- Force : 12
SHLD27A
Grâce Salvatrice +3
Il s'agissait autrefois d'un bouclier très puissant utilisé par les clercs de Baine, mais la plupart des enchantements ont disparu consécutivement à la chute du dieu. Il lui reste toutefois la base de sa protection magique, ce qui peut le rendre utile à n'importe quel aventurier.

- Classe d'armure : +4

Shields like this are first mentioned in ancient liturgies of Amaunator, in which the god's champions bear radiant shields against an infestation of undead. The shields made their first appearance in modern times in dramatic fashion, appearing miraculously at the altars of several of the deity's temples in the Year of Smoldering Spells, 1020 DR. Since that time, a number have been lost in battle, and not a few were stolen by foul creatures to prevent their use.

Once a holy artifact used by the elite sect of clerics and holy warriors called Sunmasters, part of the enchantments fled with their god's demise, but it still remain a powerful tool for any adventurer.

PARAMÈTRES : 

Capacités d'équipement : 
- Classe d'armure : +5
- TAC0 : -1
- Vitesse d'incantation des sorts profanes : -2
- Lorsque le porteur est attaqué ; Lance un sortilège

Poids : 15

Nécessite : 
- Force : 12
SHLD28
Small Shield +2
Despite the effectiveness of the enchantments on this shield, it is otherwise nondescript and defies precise identification. Such standardization makes it likely that it is from the militia of some forgotten barony, though it is hard to be certain.

– Armor Class: +3

Arcane Casting Time Penalty: +1

 6 Strength

Weight: 6

SHLD29
Medium Shield +2
A standard magical shield given to elite troops and bodyguards, this particular shield is relatively new. Forged recently by Taerom Fuiruim of Beregost, this shield has few stories to tell. Perhaps it will take a brave young warrior to perform legendary deeds while wearing it, to finally give it a history.

– THAC0: -1

SHLD30
Large Shield +2
A shield of the elite Calimport Standing Dragoons mercenary company, a group long since disbanded due to political backstabbing. Having the best of equipment, their shields were powerfully protective in combat, though the size of the shield precludes the use of the shield hand for anything else and fighting becomes more difficult because of the shield's encumbrance.

STATISTICS:

Equipped abilities:
– Armor Class: +5
– THAC0: -2

Arcane Casting Time Penalty: +3
Requires:
 15 Strength

Weight: 45

SHLD30A

Poids : 45

Nécessite : 
- Force : 15
SHLD31
Darksteel Shield +4
The dwarven clan of Clangeddin were famous for their work in darksteel, a material not to be found anywhere but within the Clangeddin clan homes within the Marching Mountains. In their efforts to find more and more darksteel, the Clangeddin delved ever deeper into the bowels of the earth.

It was on one such expedition that the seven sons of Argeld Heavyhand, the Clangeddin leader, were lost. The only survivor from the ill-fated expedition was Glimred Heavyhand, youngest son of Argeld. The lad returned with tales of drow and illithid and other darker, nameless horrors the like of which had never before been seen.

Desperate as he was to avenge his sons, Argeld could not send more of his people down into the depths of the mountain to face such horrors. Glimred himself, however, could not be dissuaded. To aid Glimred in his quest for vengeance, the dwarven smiths set about constructing the Darksteel Shield, a heavily enchanted shield that provides more protection than most suits of armor.

But Glimred was impatient, his lust for vengeance could not be deferred, and he disappeared into the bowels of the Marching Mountains before the work was completed, never to be seen again. The disappearance and presumed death of his sole surviving son proved too much for Argeld, who died from the grief of a broken heart.

With their leader dead and their hero Glimred gone, the dwarves knew it was only a matter of time before their clan was overrun by their Underdark enemies. Before dispersing across the face of Faerûn, the clan sold the shield to the highest bidder—though the dwarven smiths to this day have refused to divulge the mysterious buyer's identity.

STATISTICS:

Equipped abilities:
– Armor Class: +7
– THAC0: -2
– Elemental Resistance: +25%

Arcane Casting Time Penalty: +3
Requires:
 15 Strength

Weight: 45
The dwarven clan of Clangeddin were famous for their work in darksteel, a material not to be found anywhere but within the Clangeddin clan homes within the Marching Mountains. In their efforts to find more and more darksteel, the Clangeddin delved ever deeper into the bowels of the earth.

It was on one such expedition that the seven sons of Argeld Heavyhand, the Clangeddin leader, were lost. The only survivor from the ill-fated expedition was Glimred Heavyhand, youngest son of Argeld. The lad returned with tales of drow and illithid and other darker, nameless horrors the like of which had never before been seen.

Desperate as he was to avenge his sons, Argeld could not send more of his people down into the depths of the mountain to face such horrors. Glimred himself, however, could not be dissuaded. To aid Glimred in his quest for vengeance, the dwarven smiths set about constructing the Darksteel Shield, a heavily enchanted shield that provides more protection than most suits of armor.

But Glimred was impatient, his lust for vengeance could not be deferred, and he disappeared into the bowels of the Marching Mountains before the work was completed, never to be seen again. The disappearance and presumed death of his sole surviving son proved too much for Argeld, who died from the grief of a broken heart.

With their leader dead and their hero Glimred gone, the dwarves knew it was only a matter of time before their clan was overrun by their Underdark enemies. Before dispersing across the face of Faerûn, the clan sold the shield to the highest bidder—though the dwarven smiths to this day have refused to divulge the mysterious buyer's identity.

PARAMÈTRES : 

Capacités d'équipement : 
- Classe d'armure : +2 contre les projectiles
- Classe d'armure : +7
- TAC0 : -2
- Vitesse d'incantation des sorts profanes : -3
- Résistance aux dégâts élémentaires : +25 %

Poids : 45

Nécessite : 
- Force : 15
SHLD31A
Bouclier en sombracier +4
Forgé dans du sombracier nain, ce bouclier puissamment enchanté procure plus de protection que la plupart des armures complètes. Il aurait été fabriqué pour servir de présent au héros nain Glimred Mainlourde, mais celui-ci disparut dans les entrailles des Monts de la Marche avant que le bouclier ne soit achevé. Il fut ensuite vendu aux enchères ; les armuriers nains ne divulguèrent jamais l'identité du mystérieux acheteur.

PARAMÈTRES :

Capacités d'équipement :
- Résistance au froid : +10 %
- Résistance au feu : +10 %
- Résistance à l'acide : +10 %
- Résistance au poison : +10 %

Classe d'armure : +5, +1 bonus contre les attaques de projectiles
Nécessite :
15 en Force

Poids : 8
Forgé dans du sombracier nain, ce bouclier puissamment enchanté procure plus de protection que la plupart des armures complètes. Il aurait été fabriqué pour servir de présent au héros nain Glimred Mainlourde, mais celui-ci disparut dans les entrailles des Monts de la Marche avant que le bouclier ne soit achevé. Il fut ensuite vendu aux enchères ; les armuriers nains ne divulguèrent jamais l'identité du mystérieux acheteur.

- Vitesse d'incantation des sorts profanes : -3

- Résistance aux poisons : +10 %
- Résistance à l'acide : +10 %

Poids : 8

SHLD31_
Darksteel Shield +4

SHLD32
Shield of the Order +4
Peragath the Valiant, a great champion of the Most Noble Order of the Radiant Heart, carried this shield into battle against a horde of invading Tanar'ri pouring through a gate to the Astral Plane. Gripped by holy fervor, the mighty paladin single handedly drove back the horde, then foolishly leapt through the Astral gate to finish them off. The gate collapsed, and both Peragath and the shield were forever lost in the Planes.

STATISTICS:

Equipped abilities:
– Armor Class: +6
– THAC0: -1
– Protection from Demons: +2 to Armor Class and Saving Throws vs. demonic creatures and fallen celestials
– Spell Memorization: divine spellcasters can memorize one extra spell of each level from 1st to 4th

Arcane Casting Time Penalty: +2
Requires:
 12 Strength

Weight: 15
Peragath the Valiant, a great champion of the Most Noble Order of the Radiant Heart, carried this shield into battle against a horde of invading Tanar'ri pouring through a gate to the Astral Plane. Gripped by holy fervor, the mighty paladin single handedly drove back the horde, then foolishly leapt through the Astral gate to finish them off. The gate collapsed, and both Peragath and the shield were forever lost in the Planes.

- Jets de sauvegarde : +2 contre les devas déchues
- Jets de sauvegarde : +2 contre les démons
- Mémorisation d'un sort divin supplémentaire de niveau 1, 2, 3 et 4
- Vitesse d'incantation des sorts profanes : -2

Poids : 15

Nécessite : 
- Force : 12
SHLD33
Buckley's Buckler
A rectangle of mammoth hide forms this small shield. No amount of cleansing can dispel the pong of decay from this poorly tanned device, yet somehow the malodorous shield fortifies its wielder.

SKELSHLD
Targe +1
Une targe est un petit bouclier de bois ou de métal qui se fixe à l'avant-bras. Sa petite taille et son faible poids permettent de le porter sans être trop encombré. Cette targe possède un enchantement générique qui la rend plus résistante aux chocs.

PARAMÈTRES :

Capacités d'équipement :
- Classe d'armure : +2
- Ne protège pas contre les attaques perforantes et les projectiles

Nécessite : 4 en Force

Poids : 2
Une targe est un petit bouclier de bois ou de métal qui se fixe à l'avant-bras. Sa petite taille et son faible poids permettent de le porter sans être trop encombré. Cette targe possède un enchantement générique qui la rend plus résistante aux chocs.

- Classe d'armure : -2 contre les projectiles
- Classe d'armure : +2

Poids : 4
SKELWASU
Épée à deux mains + 1
L'épée à deux mains est un dérivé de l'épée longue. Les forgerons d'armes ont toujours cherché à améliorer les armes de leur temps. Pour l'épée longue, ils ont allongé la lame. Après la lame, c'est la poignée qui s'est allongée. Il est alors devenu nécessaire d'utiliser les deux mains pour manier l'épée. La fonction première de l'épée à deux mains est de désarçonner les chevaliers montés et de désorganiser les formations de piquiers. Cette arme est particulièrement efficace, car elle a reçu des propriétés magiques.

PARAMÈTRES :

TAC0 : +1
Dégâts : 1d10+1 (tranchant)
Facteur de vitesse : 9 
Type de compétence : épée à deux mains 
Type : arme à deux mains 
Nécessite : 14 en Force

Poids : 12
L'épée à deux mains est un dérivé de l'épée longue. Les forgerons d'armes ont toujours cherché à améliorer les armes de leur temps. Pour l'épée longue, ils ont allongé la lame. Après la lame, c'est la poignée qui s'est allongée. Il est alors devenu nécessaire d'utiliser les deux mains pour manier l'épée. La fonction première de l'épée à deux mains est de désarçonner les chevaliers montés et de désorganiser les formations de piquiers. Cette arme est particulièrement efficace, car elle a reçu des propriétés magiques.

Type de dégâts : Tranchant

Type de compétence : Épée à deux mains
Type : Arme à 2 mains

Poids : 12

Nécessite : 
- Force : 13

Capacités d'équipement : 
- Tue instantanément le porteur après 5 secondes

Poids : 0
SLNG01
Sling
Slings have existed since the beginning of recorded history. The basic sling consists of a leather or fabric strap with a pouch for holding the missile. The weapon is held by both ends of the strap and twirled around the wielder's head. When top speed is attained, the missile is launched by releasing one of the strap's ends.

STATISTICS:

Speed Factor: 6
Proficiency Type: Sling
Type: One-handed
Requires:
 3 Strength

Weight: 0
Slings have existed since the beginning of recorded history. The basic sling consists of a leather or fabric strap with a pouch for holding the missile. The weapon is held by both ends of the strap and twirled around the wielder's head. When top speed is attained, the missile is launched by releasing one of the strap's ends.

PARAMÈTRES : 

Capacités d'équipement : 
- Attaque par round : Passe à 1
- Multiplicateur d'attaque sournoise : -3

Type de dégâts : Projectile
Facteur de vitesse : 6
Type de compétence : Fronde
Type : Arme à 1 main

Poids : 0

Nécessite : 
- Force : 3
SLNG02
Sling +1
Slings have existed since the beginning of recorded history. The basic sling consists of a leather or fabric strap with a pouch for holding the missile. The weapon is held by both ends of the strap and twirled around the wielder's head. When top speed is attained, the missile is launched by releasing one of the strap's ends. This sling is particularly good at its job, as it has been enchanted with a few magical properties.

STATISTICS:

THAC0: +1
Damage: +1 (missile)
Speed Factor: 6
Proficiency Type: Sling
Type: One-handed
Requires:
 3 Strength

Weight: 0

This sling is particularly good at its job, as it has been enchanted with a few magical properties.

SLNG03
Sling of Seeking +1
The gnomes who invented this device weren't known for courage, but their tale was heroic just the same. Defending their home against bugbear invaders, the gnomes hurriedly invented a set of slings so accurate they could be fired behind the wielder's back. So prepared, the gnomes taunted their attackers into a chase, and rained stones on them over their shoulders. Though many bugbears were killed, the gnomes were eventually caught and the village destroyed.

STATISTICS:

Combat abilities:
– Seeking: +5 to THAC0

THAC0: +1
Damage: +1 (missile)
Speed Factor: 6
Proficiency Type: Sling
Type: One-handed
Requires:
 3 Strength

Weight: 0
The gnomes who invented this device weren't known for courage, but their tale was heroic just the same. So prepared, the gnomes taunted their attackers into a chase, and rained stones on them over their shoulders. Though many bugbears were killed, the gnomes were eventually caught and the village destroyed.

- Multiplicateur d'attaque sournoise : -3

- Force : 3
SLNG04
Sling +2
Magical slings are the hallmark of stout halfling warriors. Usually their mothers or a talented aunt will create such a sling for the halfling lad or lass who is about to embark on their second great adventure. The reason that the sling is given on the second adventure and not the first is that many halflings decide not to pursue the life of an adventurer after getting a taste of it.

STATISTICS:

THAC0: +2
Damage: +2 (missile)
Speed Factor: 6
Proficiency Type: Sling
Type: One-handed
Requires:
 3 Strength

Weight: 0
Magical slings are the hallmark of stout halfling warriors. Usually their mothers or a talented aunt will create such a sling for the halfling lad or lass who is about to embark on their second great adventure. The reason that the sling is given on the second adventure and not the first is that many halflings decide not to pursue the life of an adventurer after getting a taste of it.

PARAMÈTRES : 

Capacités d'équipement : 
- Attaque par round : Passe à 1
- Multiplicateur d'attaque sournoise : -3

Enchantement : +2
TAC0 : +2
Dégâts : +2
Type de dégâts : Projectile
Facteur de vitesse : 6
Type de compétence : Fronde
Type : Arme à 1 main

Poids : 0

Nécessite : 
- Force : 3
SLNG05
Arla's Dragonbane +3
None know better than halflings the value of a well-placed stone when confronting a larger foe. This particular weapon was the property of a young woman named Arla Surestep, one of the few small-folk that left the hearth to seek adventure. Legend speaks of the diminutive Arla using this sling to place a well-sharpened pebble through the skull of a green dragon in mid-flight, though the same tale in another tavern places the stone squarely in the creature's hindquarters for a more humorous than lethal effect. It would seem that halflings prefer entertainment over accuracy when it comes to history.

NOTE: Arla's Dragonbane is always considered to be of +3 enchantment when determining what it can hit.

STATISTICS:

Equipped abilities:
– Save vs. Breath: +3
– Movement Rate: +1

Combat abilities:
– Dragon Bane: +3 to THAC0 and +5 to damage against dragons

THAC0: +1
Damage: +1 (missile)
Speed Factor: 6
Proficiency Type: Sling
Type: One-handed
Requires:
 3 Strength

Weight: 0
None know better than halflings the value of a well-placed stone when confronting a larger foe. This particular weapon was the property of a young woman named Arla Surestep, one of the few small-folk that left the hearth to seek adventure. Legend speaks of the diminutive Arla using this sling to place a well-sharpened pebble through the skull of a green dragon in mid-flight, though the same tale in another tavern places the stone squarely in the creature's hindquarters for a more humorous than lethal effect. It would seem that halflings prefer entertainment over accuracy when it comes to history.

NOTE: Arla's Dragonbane is always considered to be of +3 enchantment when determining what it can hit.

PARAMÈTRES : 

Capacités d'équipement : 
- TAC0 : +3 contre les dragons
- Jets de sauvegarde : +3 contre les souffles
- Inflige 5 points de dégâts contre les dragons
- Attaque par round : Passe à 1
- Multiplicateur d'attaque sournoise : -3
- Vitesse de déplacement : +1

Enchantement : +3
TAC0 : +1
Dégâts : +1
Type de dégâts : Projectile
Facteur de vitesse : 6
Type de compétence : Fronde
Type : Arme à 1 main

Poids : 0

Nécessite : 
- Force : 3
SLNG06
Sling of Arvoreen +2
This sling is blessed by the halfling god Arvoreen. The weapon was gifted to the heroic Tuckerby Lettleworp after the Battle of Moor Road, in which an invading army of Yuan-ti were slain by Lettleworp's forces, saving his halfling village. Thought at first to be a unique item, there have actually been a number of these items found. In fact, much like the tales of Littleman, it would seem that nearly every halfling village has a similar story about the acquisition of such an item. What this means regarding their true origins is unknown.

The sling has the ability to rend the senses of the wielder's enemies with a wall of sound said to be the voice of the god himself.

STATISTICS:

Combat abilities:
– Sonic Blast: 15% chance target and opponents within 10 ft. are blasted with a powerful sonic wave, dealing 4d4 crushing and stunning them for 1 round (save vs. Breath neg. stun)

THAC0: +2
Damage: +2 (missile)
Speed Factor: 6
Proficiency Type: Sling
Type: One-handed
Requires:
 3 Strength

Weight: 0
This sling is blessed by the halfling god Arvoreen. The weapon was gifted to the heroic Tuckerby Lettleworp after the Battle of Moor Road, in which an invading army of Yuan-ti were slain by Lettleworp's forces, saving his halfling village. Thought at first to be a unique item, there have actually been a number of these items found. In fact, much like the tales of Littleman, it would seem that nearly every halfling village has a similar story about the acquisition of such an item. What this means regarding their true origins is unknown.

The sling has the ability to rend the senses of the wielder's enemies with a wall of sound said to be the voice of the god himself.

PARAMÈTRES : 

Capacités d'équipement : 
- Attaque par round : Passe à 1
- Multiplicateur d'attaque sournoise : -3

Capacités de combat : 
- 15 % de chance d'infliger 4d4 points de dégâts contondants aux adversaires dans un rayon de 3 mètres et de les étourdir pendant 1 round (jet de sauvegarde contre les sorts pour éviter d'être étourdi)

Enchantement : +2
TAC0 : +2
Dégâts : +2
Type de dégâts : Projectile
Facteur de vitesse : 6
Type de compétence : Fronde
Type : Arme à 1 main

Poids : 0

Nécessite : 
- Force : 3
SLNG07
Sling of Force +2
The gnomes who invented this device based its design on one they supposedly saw a fire giant use, reportedly "big enough to throw a donkey 300 paces." Questioning the accuracy of this account brings the predictable retort that "you'll be sorry when a giant puts YOUR ass in a sling."

Unlike most other slings, the Sling of Force is capable of throwing stones and allowing a Strength bonus to be applied to the damage it deals. Although the sling is magical, giving it a bonus to hit and to damage, it is capable of dealing Strength damage due to its design, and not due to enchantment.

STATISTICS:

Combat abilities:
– Sling of Force: wielder's Strength bonus is applied to damage

THAC0: +2
Damage: +2 (missile)
Speed Factor: 6
Proficiency Type: Sling
Type: One-handed
Requires:
 3 Strength

Weight: 0
The gnomes who invented this device based its design on one they supposedly saw a fire giant use, reportedly "big enough to throw a donkey 300 paces." Questioning the accuracy of this account brings the predictable retort that "you'll be sorry when a giant puts YOUR ass in a sling."

Unlike most other slings, the Sling of Force is capable of throwing stones and allowing a Strength bonus to be applied to the damage it deals. Although the sling is magical, giving it a bonus to hit and to damage, it is capable of dealing Strength damage due to its design, and not due to enchantment.

PARAMÈTRES : 

Capacités d'équipement : 
- Attaque par round : Passe à 1
- Multiplicateur d'attaque sournoise : -3

SLNG08
Erinne Sling +4
The gnomish village of Erinne was long protected by a single guardian, armed only with a magical sling created by the sorceress for which the town was named. When the village was overrun by orcs, the sling disappeared.

This legendary sling has no need for ammunition, as it automatically launches bullets of magical energy.

NOTE: Erinne Sling requires no ammunition, but normal bullets cannot be fired with this sling. Energy Bullets are considered to be of +4 enchantment when determining what they can hit.

STATISTICS:

Equipped abilities:
– Magic Damage Resistance: +50%

Combat abilities:
– Energy Bullet: target suffers 1d6 magic damage

THAC0: +4
Damage: 1d4+5
Speed Factor: 6
Proficiency Type: Sling
Type: One-handed
Requires:
 3 Strength

Weight: 0
The gnomish village of Erinne was long protected by a single guardian, armed only with a magical sling created by the sorceress for which the town was named. When the village was overrun by orcs, the sling disappeared.

This legendary sling has no need for ammunition, as it automatically launches bullets of magical energy.

NOTE: Erinne Sling requires no ammunition, but normal bullets cannot be fired with this sling. Energy Bullets are considered to be of +4 enchantment when determining what they can hit.

Capacités d'équipement : 
- Attaque par round : Passe à 1
- Multiplicateur d'attaque sournoise : -3
- Résistance aux dégâts magiques : +50 %
- Empêche d'utiliser Bullet of Smiting +3
- Empêche d'utiliser Bullet +3
- Empêche d'utiliser Sunstone Bullet +2
- Empêche d'utiliser Bullet +2
- Empêche d'utiliser Bullet +1
- Empêche d'utiliser Bullet

Capacités de combat : 
- Ne nécessite pas de munitions
- Inflige 1d6 points de dégâts magiques à la cible

Enchantement : +4
TAC0 : +4
Dégâts : 1d4 +5
Type de dégâts : Projectile
Facteur de vitesse : 6
Type de compétence : Fronde

SLNG09
Erinne Sling +5
The gnomish village of Erinne was long protected by a single guardian, armed only with a magical sling created by the sorceress for which the town was named. When the village was overrun by orcs, the sling disappeared. This outstanding sling is capable of infusing any projectile fired by it with magical energy, though how it does it remains a mystery.

The modifications to the Erinne sling have made significant improvements to its already impressive enchantments. The magical bullets fired from it can now burst upon impact, releasing a massive energy blast so forceful that it can potentially disintegrate opponents.

NOTE: Erinne Sling requires no ammunition, but normal bullets cannot be fired with this sling. Energy Bullets are considered to be of +5 enchantment when determining what they can hit.

STATISTICS:

Equipped abilities:
– Magic Damage Resistance: +50%

Combat abilities:
– Energy Bullet: target suffers 1d8 magic damage
– Disintegration: 15% chance target suffers 20D6 magic damage (save vs. Breath at -2 for 5d6 magic damage)

THAC0: +5
Damage: 1d4+6
Speed Factor: 6
Proficiency Type: Sling
Type: One-handed
Requires:
 3 Strength

Weight: 0
The gnomish village of Erinne was long protected by a single guardian, armed only with a magical sling created by the sorceress for which the town was named. When the village was overrun by orcs, the sling disappeared. This outstanding sling is capable of infusing any projectile fired by it with magical energy, though how it does it remains a mystery.

The modifications to the Erinne sling have made significant improvements to its already impressive enchantments. The magical bullets fired from it can now burst upon impact, releasing a massive energy blast so forceful that it can potentially disintegrate opponents.

NOTE: Erinne Sling requires no ammunition, but normal bullets cannot be fired with this sling. Energy Bullets are considered to be of +5 enchantment when determining what they can hit.

Capacités d'équipement : 
- Attaque par round : Passe à 1
- Multiplicateur d'attaque sournoise : -3
- Résistance aux dégâts magiques : +50 %
- Empêche d'utiliser Bullet of Smiting +3
- Empêche d'utiliser Bullet +3
- Empêche d'utiliser Sunstone Bullet +2
- Empêche d'utiliser Bullet +2
- Empêche d'utiliser Bullet +1
- Empêche d'utiliser Bullet

Capacités de combat : 
- Ne nécessite pas de munitions
- Inflige 1d8 points de dégâts magiques à la cible
- 15 % de chance d'infliger 15d6 points de dégâts magiques à la cible (jet de sauvegarde à -2 contre les souffles pour éviter)
- 15 % de chance d'infliger 5d6 points de dégâts magiques à la cible

Enchantement : +5
TAC0 : +5
Dégâts : 1d4 +6
Type de dégâts : Projectile
Facteur de vitesse : 6
Type de compétence : Fronde
Type : Arme à 1 main

Poids : 0

Nécessite : 
- Force : 3
SLNG10
Sling +3
Magical slings are the hallmark of stout halfling warriors. Usually their mothers or a talented aunt will create such a sling for the halfling lad or lass who is about to embark on their second great adventure. The reason that the sling is given on the second adventure and not the first is that many halflings decide not to pursue the life of an adventurer after getting a taste of it.

STATISTICS:

THAC0: +3
Damage: +3 (missile)
Speed Factor: 6
Proficiency Type: Sling
Type: One-handed
Requires:
 3 Strength

Weight: 0

SLNG11
Sling of Unerring Accuracy +1
Dandifox was one of the greatest heroes of the hin, the small people also known as halflings. From the concealment of forest arbors, he would attack rich caravans for a "tithe," which he then distributed among the local poor. The heroic robber finally met his end on the point of a guardsman's spear, but not before the constabulary had learned to fear and hate his infallible aim.

STATISTICS:

Equipped abilities:
– Accuracy: +1 to THAC0

THAC0: +1
Damage: +1 (missile)
Speed Factor: 6
Proficiency Type: Sling
Type: One-handed
Requires:
 3 Strength

Weight: 0

SORB
Orbe desséchant


Capacités d'équipement : 
- Multiplicateur d'attaque sournoise : -1

Capacités de charge : 
- Capacité 1 (1 charge, l'objet est détruit quand la charge est utilisée)
  Inflige 6d6 points de dégâts de feu à la cible (jet de sauvegarde contre les sorts pour éviter)
  Inflige 6d6 points de dégâts de feu contre les morts-vivants
  Aveugle les morts-vivants pendant 6 rounds
  Aveugle les morts-vivants (jet de sauvegarde contre les sorts pour éviter)
  17 % de chance d'aveugler la cible pendant 1 round (jet de sauvegarde contre les sorts pour éviter)
  17 % de chance d'aveugler la cible pendant 2 rounds (jet de sauvegarde contre les sorts pour éviter)
  17 % de chance d'aveugler la cible pendant 3 rounds (jet de sauvegarde contre les sorts pour éviter)
  17 % de chance d'aveugler la cible pendant 4 rounds (jet de sauvegarde contre les sorts pour éviter)
  17 % de chance d'aveugler la cible pendant 5 rounds (jet de sauvegarde contre les sorts pour éviter)
  16 % de chance d'aveugler la cible pendant 6 rounds (jet de sauvegarde contre les sorts pour éviter)

Enchantement : +6

SPEC01
Anneau d'action libre : « Cadeau d'Edventar »
Cet anneau fut donné à Edventar, le chasseur et écumeur de récifs, par un groupe d'elfes aquatiques, ses amis de longue date. En aidant dans sa fuite Yenandra de Dambrath, la « Reine des Pirates », Edventar leur permit en effet de survivre. Mais Yenandra est toujours crainte le long de toutes les côtes.

PARAMÈTRES :

Capacités d'équipement :
- Le porteur est immunisé contre tout ce qui, magique ou non, pourrait affecter sa mobilité, y compris les sorts de rapidité et de ralentissement.

Poids : 0
Anneau d'action libre : « Cadeau d'Edventar »
Cet anneau fut donné à Edventar, le chasseur et écumeur de récifs, par un groupe d'elfes aquatiques, ses amis de longue date. En aidant dans sa fuite Yenandra de Dambrath, la « Reine des Pirates », Edventar leur permit en effet de survivre. Mais Yenandra est toujours crainte le long de toutes les côtes.

PARAMÈTRES : 

Capacités d'équipement : 
- Le moral du porteur reste au plus haut
- Hâte
- Immunité à l'horreur
- Immunité à la peur
- Immunité à la panique
- Immunité contre les armes non-magiques

Poids : 0
SPEC02


Capacités d'équipement : 
- Le moral du porteur reste au plus haut
- Hâte
- Immunité à l'horreur
- Immunité à la peur
- Immunité à la panique
- Immunité contre les armes non-magiques

Poids : 0
SPER01
Spear
Among mankind's earliest weapons, dating back to the most primitive of times, the first spears were simply wooden poles or sticks that had been sharpened at one end. Upon mastering the use of metals, weaponsmiths forged spear heads from iron and steel, and began experimenting with different types of spear heads, thus leading to the development of certain types of polearms.

STATISTICS:

Damage: 1d8 (piercing)
Speed Factor: 6
Proficiency Type: Spear
Type: Two-handed
Requires:
 5 Strength

Weight: 5
Among mankind's earliest weapons, dating back to the most primitive of times, the first spears were simply wooden poles or sticks that had been sharpened at one end. Upon mastering the use of metals, weaponsmiths forged spear heads from iron and steel, and began experimenting with different types of spear heads, thus leading to the development of certain types of polearms.

PARAMÈTRES : 

Capacités d'équipement : 
- Multiplicateur d'attaque sournoise : -3

Dégâts : 1d8 
Type de dégâts : Perforant
Facteur de vitesse : 6
Type de compétence : Lance
Type : Arme à 2 mains

Poids : 5

Nécessite : 
- Force : 5
SPER02
Spear +1
Among mankind's earliest weapons, dating back to the most primitive of times, the first spears were simply wooden poles or sticks that had been sharpened at one end. Upon mastering the use of metals, weaponsmiths forged spear heads from iron and steel, and began experimenting with different types of spear heads, thus leading to the development of certain types of polearms. This spear is particularly good at its job, as it has been enchanted with a few magical properties.

STATISTICS:

THAC0: +1
Damage: 1d8+1 (piercing)
Speed Factor: 6
Proficiency Type: Spear
Type: Two-handed
Requires:
 5 Strength

Weight: 5
Among mankind's earliest weapons, dating back to the most primitive of times, the first spears were simply wooden poles or sticks that had been sharpened at one end. Upon mastering the use of metals, weaponsmiths forged spear heads from iron and steel, and began experimenting with different types of spear heads, thus leading to the development of certain types of polearms. This spear is particularly good at its job, as it has been enchanted with a few magical properties.

Type : Arme à 2 mains

SPER03
Backbiter +3
This cursed spear has the appearance of a magical barbed spear. However, when a combat situation arises, Backbiter will attack the wielder once for every attack made against the wielder's foe. This is a powerful spear, but one must ask if such power is worth using in the end. Backbiter can only be removed through the use of magic.

STATISTICS:

*CURSED*

Combat abilities:
– Very Keen: +10% chance to score critical hits
– Vicious: target suffers 2d6 piercing damage, wielder suffers 1d6 piercing damage

THAC0: +3
Damage: 1d8+3 (piercing)
Speed Factor: 6
Proficiency Type: Spear
Type: Two-handed
Requires:
 5 Strength

Weight: 5
This cursed spear has the appearance of a magical barbed spear. However, when a combat situation arises, Backbiter will attack the wielder once for every attack made against the wielder's foe. This is a powerful spear, but one must ask if such power is worth using in the end. Backbiter can only be removed through the use of magic.

PARAMÈTRES : 

Capacités d'équipement : 
- Maudit : Ne peut être ôté qu'à l'aide d'un sort de Délivrance de la malédiction
- Chance de coup critique : +10 %
- Multiplicateur d'attaque sournoise : -3

Capacités de combat : 
- Inflige 1d6 points de dégâts perforants au porteur
- Inflige 2d6 points de dégâts perforants à la cible

Enchantement : +3
TAC0 : +3
Dégâts : 1d8 +3
Type de dégâts : Perforant
Facteur de vitesse : 6
Type de compétence : Lance
Type : Arme à 2 mains

Poids : 5

Nécessite : 
- Force : 5
SPER04
Javelin
The javelin is a type of light spear designed for throwing, usually with a narrower tip. While this makes it less resilient and powerful in close quarter combat, it can be a deadly weapon if the advantage of its range is used to its fullest extent.

STATISTICS:

Damage: 1d6
Damage Type (melee): Piercing
Damage Type (thrown): Missile
Speed Factor: 6
Proficiency Type: Spear
Type: Two-handed
Requires:
 5 Strength

Weight: 5
The javelin is a type of light spear designed for throwing, usually with a narrower tip. While this makes it less resilient and powerful in close quarter combat, it can be a deadly weapon if the advantage of its range is used to its fullest extent.

PARAMÈTRES : 

Capacités d'équipement : 
- Multiplicateur d'attaque sournoise : -3

Capacités de charge : 
- Thrown (1 charge, l'objet est détruit quand la charge est utilisée)

Dégâts : 1d6 
Type de dégâts : Perforant (Melee)
Type de dégâts : Projectile (Thrown)
Facteur de vitesse : 6
Type de compétence : Lance
Type : Arme à 2 mains

Poids : 5

Nécessite : 
- Force : 5
SPER05
Spear +2
Among mankind's earliest weapons, dating back to the most primitive of times, the first spears were simply wooden poles or sticks that had been sharpened at one end. Upon mastering the use of metals, weaponsmiths forged spear heads from iron and steel, and began experimenting with different types of spear heads, thus leading to the development of certain types of polearms. Another line of tinkering led to the use of magic in spear construction. Tribal shamans would enchant a spear so that it would hit more often, and do greater damage to its wielder's opponents.

STATISTICS:

THAC0: +2
Damage: 1d8+2 (piercing)
Speed Factor: 6
Proficiency Type: Spear
Type: Two-handed
Requires:
 5 Strength

Weight: 5
Among mankind's earliest weapons, dating back to the most primitive of times, the first spears were simply wooden poles or sticks that had been sharpened at one end. Upon mastering the use of metals, weaponsmiths forged spear heads from iron and steel, and began experimenting with different types of spear heads, thus leading to the development of certain types of polearms. Another line of tinkering led to the use of magic in spear construction. Tribal shamans would enchant a spear so that it would hit more often, and do greater damage to its wielder's opponents.

PARAMÈTRES : 

Capacités d'équipement : 
- Multiplicateur d'attaque sournoise : -3

Enchantement : +2
TAC0 : +2
Dégâts : 1d8 +2
Type de dégâts : Perforant
Facteur de vitesse : 6
Type de compétence : Lance
Type : Arme à 2 mains

Poids : 5

SPER06
Spear +3
Among mankind's earliest weapons, dating back to the most primitive of times, the first spears were simply wooden poles or sticks that had been sharpened at one end. Upon mastering the use of metals, weaponsmiths forged spear heads from iron and steel, and began experimenting with different types of spear heads, thus leading to the development of certain types of polearms. This spear trembles from the powerful magic used in its creation.

SPER07
Spear of the Unicorn +2
This graceful spear is carved to resemble the elongated horn of a unicorn. Wielders of this spear are immune to charm and hold spells, just as a unicorn might be. Whether the horn is or isn't an actual unicorn horn is the subject of much debate.

STATISTICS:

Equipped abilities:
– Save vs. Death: +3
– Protects Against: Charm, Domination, and Hold

THAC0: +2
Damage: 1d8+2 (piercing)
Speed Factor: 6
Proficiency Type: Spear
Type: Two-handed
Requires:
 5 Strength

Weight: 3
This graceful spear is carved to resemble the elongated horn of a unicorn. Wielders of this spear are immune to charm and hold spells, just as a unicorn might be. Whether the horn is or isn't an actual unicorn horn is the subject of much debate.

PARAMÈTRES : 

Capacités d'équipement : 
- Jets de sauvegarde : +3 contre la paralysie, la mort et les poisons
- Multiplicateur d'attaque sournoise : -3
- Immunité à la paralysie
- Immunité aux charmes

Enchantement : +2
TAC0 : +2
Dégâts : 1d8 +2
Type de dégâts : Perforant
Facteur de vitesse : 6
Type de compétence : Lance
Type : Arme à 2 mains

Poids : 3

Nécessite : 
- Force : 5
SPER08
Impaler +3
Pergad the Red-Handed was a famous barbarian warrior near Silverymoon in the 11th century, Dale Reckoning. His tribe's battles against hordes of orcs, goblins, and hill giants are legendary throughout the north. Unfortunately for Pergad, the other tribes of the region decided to move south or settle in the cities of the north rather than fight against the seemingly endless waves of foes. Pergad's tribe, the Tribe of Dead Trees, was the last to make a stand. Though Pergad emerged victorious in a series of difficult battles, his tribe dwindled as quickly as the horde grew. At the Battle of Surbrin Shallows in 1014 DR, Pergad's tribe finally came to its end under cruel ogre clubs and giant-hurled rocks. Legend states that when Pergad finally realized that his tribe was doomed, he drove his trusted spear into the Surbrin riverbed, cursing all the goblins who crossed over the water that his people once thrived on. Orcish shamans claim that the spot where his spear penetrated the rock bled for days. A year later, two tribes of goblins were wiped out by a plague that spread among them after they settled in the Surbrin river valley. The spear subsequently disappeared in the river's currents, and was supposedly dragged into the open sea.

The Impaler has a palpable aura of magic that hints at the nature of the weapon and why it has been the bane of several powerful orc chieftains in the past. As one would guess, when a victim is struck, they are very nearly impaled as the massive enchantment does its dirty work.

STATISTICS:

Combat abilities:
– Impaling: target suffers 1d10 piercing damage, 15% chance target dies (save vs. Death negates)
– Returning: returns to the wielder's hand instantly after an attack is made

THAC0: +3
Damage: 1d8+3
Damage Type (melee): Piercing
Damage Type (thrown): Missile
Speed Factor: 6
Proficiency Type: Spear
Type: Two-handed
Requires:
 5 Strength

Weight: 5
Pergad the Red-Handed was a famous barbarian warrior near Silverymoon in the 11th century, Dale Reckoning. His tribe's battles against hordes of orcs, goblins, and hill giants are legendary throughout the north. Unfortunately for Pergad, the other tribes of the region decided to move south or settle in the cities of the north rather than fight against the seemingly endless waves of foes. Pergad's tribe, the Tribe of Dead Trees, was the last to make a stand. Though Pergad emerged victorious in a series of difficult battles, his tribe dwindled as quickly as the horde grew. At the Battle of Surbrin Shallows in 1014 DR, Pergad's tribe finally came to its end under cruel ogre clubs and giant-hurled rocks. Legend states that when Pergad finally realized that his tribe was doomed, he drove his trusted spear into the Surbrin riverbed, cursing all the goblins who crossed over the water that his people once thrived on. Orcish shamans claim that the spot where his spear penetrated the rock bled for days. A year later, two tribes of goblins were wiped out by a plague that spread among them after they settled in the Surbrin river valley. The spear subsequently disappeared in the river's currents, and was supposedly dragged into the open sea.

The Impaler has a palpable aura of magic that hints at the nature of the weapon and why it has been the bane of several powerful orc chieftains in the past. As one would guess, when a victim is struck, they are very nearly impaled as the massive enchantment does its dirty work.

PARAMÈTRES : 

Capacités d'équipement : 
- Multiplicateur d'attaque sournoise : -3

Capacités de combat : 
- Revient dans la main du lanceur
- Inflige 1d10 points de dégâts perforants à la cible
- 15 % de chance de tuer instantanément la cible (jet de sauvegarde contre la paralysie, la mort et les poisons pour éviter)

Enchantement : +3
TAC0 : +3
Dégâts : 1d8 +3
Type de dégâts : Perforant (Melee)
Type de dégâts : Projectile (Thrown)
Facteur de vitesse : 6
Type de compétence : Lance
Type : Arme à 2 mains

Poids : 5

Nécessite : 
- Force : 5
SPER09
Talos' Fury +2
Talos, the god of storms, occasionally grants his followers spears such as this as symbols of his power and authority. The electrum plated shaft of this weapon hums with magical power and blue bolts of energy run down the length of the spear, charging it. In battle, when it hits an opponent, it strikes for additional electrical damage. When hurled the lightning bolt like spear magically reappears in the wielder's hand after reaching the target. These weapons are highly sought after by adventurers for their great power.

STATISTICS:

Combat abilities:
– Shocking: target suffers 1d4 electrical damage
– Returning: returns to the wielder's hand instantly after an attack is made

THAC0: +2
Damage: 1d8+2
Damage Type (melee): Piercing
Damage Type (thrown): Missile
Speed Factor: 6
Proficiency Type: Spear
Type: Two-handed
Requires:
 5 Strength

Weight: 5
Talos, the god of storms, occasionally grants his followers spears such as this as symbols of his power and authority. The electrum plated shaft of this weapon hums with magical power and blue bolts of energy run down the length of the spear, charging it. In battle, when it hits an opponent, it strikes for additional electrical damage. When hurled the lightning bolt like spear magically reappears in the wielder's hand after reaching the target. These weapons are highly sought after by adventurers for their great power.

- Multiplicateur d'attaque sournoise : -3

- Revient dans la main du lanceur
- Inflige 1d4 points de dégâts d'électricité à la cible

SPER10
Spear of Withering +3
The Year of the Awakening, 1001 DR, saw the re-emergence of many ancient evils as treasure-hungry explorers unearthed ruins in several locations. One such breach freed Sek'co Tul, a lich imprisoned beneath the Forest of Mir. He left for some unknown hold, but his opened tomb quickly tainted trees in the area. Druids cleansed the area with fire, but some of the wood was taken by a local mage and made into this spear.

Carved from the heart of a rotten Treant, this spear reeks of death. When held in your hands it groans a little, as if reluctant to allow a living thing to touch it. In battle, the Spear of Withering spits a foul poison into its target upon each successful hit.

STATISTICS:

Combat abilities:
– Poisonous: target suffers 1d6 poison damage
– Scourging: 15% chance target is stricken with a disease, suffering 1 damage per second and slowness for 1 turn (save vs. Death at -2 negates)

THAC0: +3
Damage: 1d8+3 (piercing)
Speed Factor: 6
Proficiency Type: Spear
Type: Two-handed
Requires:
 5 Strength

Weight: 5
The Year of the Awakening, 1001 DR, saw the re-emergence of many ancient evils as treasure-hungry explorers unearthed ruins in several locations. One such breach freed Sek'co Tul, a lich imprisoned beneath the Forest of Mir. He left for some unknown hold, but his opened tomb quickly tainted trees in the area. Druids cleansed the area with fire, but some of the wood was taken by a local mage and made into this spear.

Carved from the heart of a rotten Treant, this spear reeks of death. When held in your hands it groans a little, as if reluctant to allow a living thing to touch it. In battle, the Spear of Withering spits a foul poison into its target upon each successful hit.

PARAMÈTRES : 

Capacités d'équipement : 
- Multiplicateur d'attaque sournoise : -3

Capacités de combat : 
- Inflige 1d6 points de dégâts de poison à la cible

TAC0 : +3
Dégâts : 1d8 +3
Type de dégâts : Perforant
Facteur de vitesse : 6
Type de compétence : Lance
Type : Arme à 2 mains

Poids : 5

Nécessite : 
- Force : 5
SPER11
Ixil's Nail +4
Shortly after the Time of Troubles began the nomadic bandit tribes of the Calimshan desert were united under a single leader; a cruel and brutal giant of a man, the warlord Ixil Xaxsha. From their outposts in the forbidding desert waste, the nomads raided merchant caravans and terrorized travelers who dared journey over the road from Calimport to Myratma.

Rumors and legends quickly spread about the invincible Ixil, who rode at the head of every raiding party brandishing his infamous magical spear. Some believe he was not truly a man, but a demon in human form, drawn to Faerûn by the chaos and confusion of the Time of Troubles.

Ixil's own sadism and savagery did little to quell these allegations. During battle the head of Ixil's Spike, his mighty spear, would detach to pin opponents to the ground even as a new head magically reformed on the end of the spear. Often in the thick of combat, Ixil would pause to savor the helpless struggles of an enemy impaled by the point of his spear... seeming to delight in the writhing agony of his enemy.

The warlord was finally defeated when he was lured into attacking a contingent of powerful priests and knights from the Order of the Radiant Heart, posing as simple pilgrims. Witnesses to the battle claim Ixil was not slain, but was in fact banished to some hellish outer plane by the holy magic of the Order.

Though Ixil's body was never found, Ixil's Spike, his fearsome spear and the symbol of his power, was recovered. In an effort to utterly destroy the artifact, it was shattered into several pieces, which were scattered about the Southlands. For many generations this magical shaft has been separated from Ixil's Spike, the enchanted head of the legendary spear. However, even incomplete, this artifact is still a weapon of great power.

STATISTICS:

Equipped abilities:
– Spell: Free Action

THAC0: +4
Damage: 1d8+4 (piercing)
Speed Factor: 6
Proficiency Type: Spear
Type: Two-handed
Requires:
 5 Strength

Weight: 5
Shortly after the Time of Troubles began the nomadic bandit tribes of the Calimshan desert were united under a single leader; a cruel and brutal giant of a man, the warlord Ixil Xaxsha. From their outposts in the forbidding desert waste, the nomads raided merchant caravans and terrorized travelers who dared journey over the road from Calimport to Myratma.

Rumors and legends quickly spread about the invincible Ixil, who rode at the head of every raiding party brandishing his infamous magical spear. Some believe he was not truly a man, but a demon in human form, drawn to Faerûn by the chaos and confusion of the Time of Troubles.

Ixil's own sadism and savagery did little to quell these allegations. During battle the head of Ixil's Spike, his mighty spear, would detach to pin opponents to the ground even as a new head magically reformed on the end of the spear. Often in the thick of combat, Ixil would pause to savor the helpless struggles of an enemy impaled by the point of his spear... seeming to delight in the writhing agony of his enemy.

The warlord was finally defeated when he was lured into attacking a contingent of powerful priests and knights from the Order of the Radiant Heart, posing as simple pilgrims. Witnesses to the battle claim Ixil was not slain, but was in fact banished to some hellish outer plane by the holy magic of the Order.

Though Ixil's body was never found, Ixil's Spike, his fearsome spear and the symbol of his power, was recovered. In an effort to utterly destroy the artifact, it was shattered into several pieces, which were scattered about the Southlands. For many generations this magical shaft has been separated from Ixil's Spike, the enchanted head of the legendary spear. However, even incomplete, this artifact is still a weapon of great power.

PARAMÈTRES : 

Capacités d'équipement : 
- Multiplicateur d'attaque sournoise : -3
- Immunité au sort Lenteur du Golem
- Immunité au sort Sphère résistante d'Otiluke
- Immunité au sort Lent
- Immunité au sort Glisse
- Immunité au sort Enchevêtrement
- Immunité aux toiles
- Immunité à la lenteur
- Immunité aux effets affectant la vitesse de déplacement
- Immunité à la paralysie
- Action libre

Enchantement : +4
TAC0 : +4
Dégâts : 1d8 +4
Type de dégâts : Perforant
Facteur de vitesse : 6
Type de compétence : Lance
Type : Arme à 2 mains

Poids : 5

SPER12
Ixil's Spike +5
Shortly after the Time of Troubles began the nomadic bandit tribes of the Calimshan desert were united under a single leader; a cruel and brutal giant of a man, the warlord Ixil Xaxsha. From their outposts in the forbidding desert waste, the nomads raided merchant caravans and terrorized travelers who dared journey over the road from Calimport to Myratma.

Rumors and legends quickly spread about the invincible Ixil, who rode at the head of every raiding party brandishing his infamous magical spear. Some believe he was not truly a man, but a demon in human form, drawn to Faerûn by the chaos and confusion of the Time of Troubles.

Ixil's own sadism and savagery did little to quell these allegations. During battle the head of Ixil's Spike, his mighty spear, would detach to pin opponents to the ground even as a new head magically reformed on the end of the spear. Often in the thick of combat, Ixil would pause to savor the helpless struggles of an enemy impaled by the point of his spear... seeming to delight in the writhing agony of his enemy.

The warlord was finally defeated when he was lured into attacking a contingent of powerful priests and knights from the Order of the Radiant Heart, posing as simple pilgrims. Witnesses to the battle claim Ixil was not slain, but was in fact banished to some hellish outer plane by the holy magic of the Order.

Though Ixil's body was never found, Ixil's Spike, his fearsome spear and the symbol of his power, was recovered. In an effort to utterly destroy the artifact, it was shattered into several pieces, which were scattered about the Southlands. With shaft and tip reunited, Ixil's Spike can now display its true potential.

STATISTICS:

Equipped abilities:
– Spell: Free Action

Combat abilities:
– Keen: +5% chance to score critical hits
– Pinning: target is held for 2 rounds, taking 1d6+5 damage every round (save vs. Death at -2 negates)

THAC0: +5
Damage: 1d8+5 (piercing)
Speed Factor: 6
Proficiency Type: Spear
Type: Two-handed
Requires:
 5 Strength

Weight: 5
Shortly after the Time of Troubles began the nomadic bandit tribes of the Calimshan desert were united under a single leader; a cruel and brutal giant of a man, the warlord Ixil Xaxsha. From their outposts in the forbidding desert waste, the nomads raided merchant caravans and terrorized travelers who dared journey over the road from Calimport to Myratma.

Rumors and legends quickly spread about the invincible Ixil, who rode at the head of every raiding party brandishing his infamous magical spear. Some believe he was not truly a man, but a demon in human form, drawn to Faerûn by the chaos and confusion of the Time of Troubles.

Ixil's own sadism and savagery did little to quell these allegations. During battle the head of Ixil's Spike, his mighty spear, would detach to pin opponents to the ground even as a new head magically reformed on the end of the spear. Often in the thick of combat, Ixil would pause to savor the helpless struggles of an enemy impaled by the point of his spear... seeming to delight in the writhing agony of his enemy.

The warlord was finally defeated when he was lured into attacking a contingent of powerful priests and knights from the Order of the Radiant Heart, posing as simple pilgrims. Witnesses to the battle claim Ixil was not slain, but was in fact banished to some hellish outer plane by the holy magic of the Order.

Though Ixil's body was never found, Ixil's Spike, his fearsome spear and the symbol of his power, was recovered. In an effort to utterly destroy the artifact, it was shattered into several pieces, which were scattered about the Southlands. With shaft and tip reunited, Ixil's Spike can now display its true potential.

PARAMÈTRES : 

Capacités d'équipement : 
- Chance de coup critique : +5 %
- Multiplicateur d'attaque sournoise : -3
- Immunité au sort Lenteur du Golem
- Immunité au sort Sphère résistante d'Otiluke
- Immunité au sort Lent
- Immunité au sort Glisse
- Immunité au sort Enchevêtrement
- Immunité aux toiles
- Immunité à la lenteur
- Immunité aux effets affectant la vitesse de déplacement
- Immunité à la paralysie
- Action libre

Capacités de combat : 
- Immobilise et inflige 1d4 +5 points de dégâts perforants supplémentaires à chaque round à la cible pendant 2 rounds (jet de sauvegarde contre la paralysie, la mort et les poisons pour éviter)

Enchantement : +5
TAC0 : +5
Dégâts : 1d8 +5
Type de dégâts : Perforant
Facteur de vitesse : 6
Type de compétence : Lance
Type : Arme à 2 mains

Poids : 5

Nécessite : 
- Force : 5
SPERMEL


Capacités d'équipement : 
- Multiplicateur d'attaque sournoise : -3

Capacités de combat : 
- Réduit de 1 les jets de sauvegarde contre la paralysie, la mort et les poisons de la cible pendant 2 rounds
- Réduit de 1 les jets de sauvegarde contre les baguettes, les sceptres et les bâtons de la cible pendant 2 rounds
- Réduit de 1 les jets de sauvegarde contre la pétrification et la métamorphose de la cible pendant 2 rounds
- Réduit de 1 les jets de sauvegarde contre les souffles de la cible pendant 2 rounds
- Réduit de 1 les jets de sauvegarde contre les sorts de la cible pendant 2 rounds
- Inflige 2d10 points de dégâts de froid à la cible
- Réduit de 5 % la rsistance  la magie de la cible pendant 2 rounds
- Tue instantanément les créatures convoquées
- Tue instantanément les morts-vivants
- 75 % de chance d'infliger lenteur à la cible pendant 3 rounds (jet de sauvegarde à -4 contre les sorts pour éviter)
- 26 % de chance d'étourdir la cible pendant 3 rounds (jet de sauvegarde à -4 contre les sorts pour éviter)

Enchantement : +5
TAC0 : +5
Dégâts : 1d8 +5
Type de dégâts : Perforant
Facteur de vitesse : 6
Type de compétence : Lance
Type : Arme à 2 mains

Poids : 3

Nécessite : 
- Force : 5
SPIDWR


Capacités de combat : 
- Réduit de 1 le niveau de la cible (de niveau 6 ou supérieur) de manière permanente
- Réduit de 5 la constitution de la cible (de niveau 6 ou supérieur) (jet de sauvegarde contre la paralysie, la mort et les poisons pour éviter)

Dégâts : 1d4 
Type de dégâts : Contondant
Facteur de vitesse : 0
Type de compétence : Grande épée
Type : Arme à 1 main

Poids : 0

SPRNGB01
Vous auriez dû faire preuve de plus de prudence, porter une telle chose dans cette partie de la ville... Avez-vous essayé de revenir sur vos pas ?
Cette histoire d'assassin rôdant dans le quartier me fiche la chair de poule !
Cette histoire d'assassin rôdant dans le quartier me fiche la chair de poule !

Capacités d'équipement : 
- Le moral du porteur reste au plus haut
- Immunité au remplacement de créature
- Immunité à la panique
- Immunité à la peur
- Immunité à la folie du berserker
- Immunité à l'horreur
- 1 % de chance d'immuniser le porteur au sort Sphère du chaos
- 1 % de chance d'immuniser le porteur au sort Métamorphose d'autrui

Poids : 0
SPRNGB02
Vous auriez dû faire preuve de plus de prudence, porter une telle chose dans cette partie de la ville... Avez-vous essayé de revenir sur vos pas ?
Cette histoire d'assassin rôdant dans le quartier me fiche la chair de poule !
Cette histoire d'assassin rôdant dans le quartier me fiche la chair de poule !

Capacités d'équipement : 
- Résistance aux poisons : +25 %
- Le moral du porteur reste au plus haut
- Immunité au sort Ordre Majeur
- Immunité au sort Injonction
- Immunité à la fatigue
- Immunité au sommeil
- Immunité au remplacement de créature
- Immunité à la panique
- Immunité à la peur
- Immunité à la folie du berserker
- Immunité à l'horreur
- 1 % de chance d'immuniser le porteur au sort Sphère du chaos
- 1 % de chance d'immuniser le porteur au sort Métamorphose d'autrui

Poids : 0
SPRNGB03

Cette histoire d'assassin rôdant dans le quartier me fiche la chair de poule !

SPSATT1
Attaquer


Capacités d'équipement : 
- Vitesse de déplacement : Passe à 8

Capacités de combat : 
- Inefficace contre les cibles immunisées au poison
- Inefficace contre les morts-vivants et les golems
- Empoisonne la cible et lui inflige 2 points de dégâts par seconde pendant 3 secondes (jet de sauvegarde à +3 contre la paralysie, la mort et les poisons pour éviter)

Enchantement : +4
Dégâts : 1d4 
Type de dégâts : Perforant
Facteur de vitesse : 2
Type de compétence : Grande épée
Type : Arme à 1 main

Poids : 0

SPWATT5
Attaquer


Capacités d'équipement : 
- Vitesse de déplacement : Passe à 10

Capacités de combat : 
- Draine 1 niveau à la cible de manière permanente (jet de sauvegarde à +1 contre la paralysie, la mort et les poisons pour éviter)
- Inflige 1d6 points de dégâts de froid à la cible
- Paralyse la cible pendant 7 secondes (jet de sauvegarde à +1 contre la paralysie, la mort et les poisons pour éviter)

Enchantement : +6
Dégâts : 1d4 
Type de dégâts : Perforant
Facteur de vitesse : 2
Type de compétence : Grande épée
Type : Arme à 1 main

Poids : 0
SQUIRP


Capacités d'équipement : 
- Classe d'armure de base : 10
- Empêche l'incantation des sorts profanes
- Empêche l'incantation des sorts divins
- Points de vie maximum : Passe à 5
- Force : Passe à 3
- Transforme le porteur en Écureuil

Dégâts : 1d2 
Type de dégâts : Tranchant
Facteur de vitesse : 3
Type de compétence : Grande épée
Type : Arme à 1 main

Poids : 0
STAF01
Quarterstaff
The simplest and humblest of staff weapons, the quarterstaff is a length of wood ranging six to nine feet in length. High quality quarterstaves are made of stout oak and are shod with metal at both ends. The quarterstaff must be wielded with both hands.

STATISTICS:

Damage: 1d6 (crushing)
Speed Factor: 4
Proficiency Type: Quarterstaff
Type: Two-handed
Requires:
 5 Strength

Weight: 4

Facteur de vitesse : 4
Type de compétence : Bâton
Type : Arme à 2 mains

STAF02
Quarterstaff +1
The simplest and humblest of staff weapons, the quarterstaff is a length of wood ranging six to nine feet in length. High quality quarterstaves are made of stout oak and are shod with metal at both ends. The quarterstaff must be wielded with both hands. This quarterstaff is particularly good at its job, as it has been enchanted with a few magical properties.

STATISTICS:

THAC0: +1
Damage: 1d6+1 (crushing)
Speed Factor: 4
Proficiency Type: Quarterstaff
Type: Two-handed
Requires:
 5 Strength

STAF05
Staff of Striking +3
Staves of Striking are made by the Gold Elves of Drelagara on Evermeet. Such staves seem to have a life of their own, and jump to attack in their bearer's hands. The elven craftsmen rarely sell them to other races, but these powerful melee weapons do surface occasionally in Faerûn. This weapon can deal tremendous damage, but each attack made with it partially consumes the energy of the staff, causing it to destroy itself when none of its 25 charges remain. If it's not destroyed, the staff fully recharges itself each morning.

STATISTICS:

Combat Abilities (consumes charges):
– Striking: target suffers 6 crushing damage

THAC0: +3
Damage: 1d6+3 (crushing)
Speed Factor: 4
Proficiency Type: Quarterstaff
Type: Two-handed
Requires:
 5 Strength

Weight: 4
Staves of Striking are made by the Gold Elves of Drelagara on Evermeet. Such staves seem to have a life of their own, and jump to attack in their bearer's hands. The elven craftsmen rarely sell them to other races, but these powerful melee weapons do surface occasionally in Faerûn. This weapon can deal tremendous damage, but each attack made with it partially consumes the energy of the staff, causing it to destroy itself when none of its 25 charges remain. If it's not destroyed, the staff fully recharges itself each morning.

PARAMÈTRES : 

Capacités d'équipement : 
- Multiplicateur d'attaque sournoise : -2

Capacités de charge : 
- Inflige 6 points de dégâts contondants à la cible (25 charges, l'objet est détruit quand toutes les charges sont utilisées)

Enchantement : +3
TAC0 : +3
Dégâts : 1d6 +3
Type de dégâts : Contondant
Facteur de vitesse : 4
Type de compétence : Bâton
Type : Arme à 2 mains

Poids : 4

Nécessite : 
- Force : 5
STAF06
Staff Mace +2
This weapon appears to be a normal walking staff, but it has a faint aura of alteration magic. Uttering the command word causes the staff to assume the attributes of a mace, allowing it to be wielded with one hand. This was likely designed for priests or druids, though that does not preclude its use by most others.

STATISTICS:

THAC0: +2
Damage: 1d6+2
Speed Factor: 4 (crushing)
Proficiency Type: Quarterstaff
Type: One-handed
Requires:
 5 Strength

Weight: 4

Uttering the command word causes the staff to assume the attributes of a mace, allowing it to be wielded with one hand. This was likely designed for priests or druids, though that does not preclude its use by most others.

STAF07

When examined, this quarterstaff has an aura of alteration, and a long sharp spearhead extends from its upper end on command. Likely made by a wizard or priest hoping to increase their melee abilities, it can be used by anyone capable of handling a staff.

STAF08

This humble staff radiates powerful magic, and was likely the weapon of a traveling martial artist. It would certainly prove more than ample for dealing with most threats encountered on the road.

– Parrying: +2 to Armor Class (none vs. missile attacks)

Combat abilities:
– Impactful: +10% chance to score critical hits

STAF08_
Aule's Staff +3
This finely crafted stave was among the spoils taken from the invaders of Durlag's Tower. It is very deadly in combat, and was apparently the property of a spellcaster that enjoyed standing on the frontlines. It appears to have a core of iron, yet it is comparable in weight to a normal weapon of its type. Part of the enchantment seems to come from the hide that strengthens the grip; leather no doubt made from a battle-ready creature of some sort. With the tastes and inclinations of the attackers of the Tower well documented, the hide could be almost anything...or anyone.

STATISTICS:

Combat Abilities:
– Powerful Weapon: +2 to damage

THAC0: +3
Damage: 1d6+3 (crushing)
Speed Factor: 4
Proficiency Type: Quarterstaff
Type: Two-handed
Requires:
 8 Strength

Weight: 5
This finely crafted stave was among the spoils taken from the invaders of Durlag's Tower. It is very deadly in combat, and was apparently the property of a spellcaster that enjoyed standing on the frontlines. It appears to have a core of iron, yet it is comparable in weight to a normal weapon of its type. Part of the enchantment seems to come from the hide that strengthens the grip; leather no doubt made from a battle-ready creature of some sort. With the tastes and inclinations of the attackers of the Tower well documented, the hide could be almost anything...or anyone.

PARAMÈTRES : 

Capacités d'équipement : 
- Chance de coup critique : +10 %
- Multiplicateur d'attaque sournoise : -2

Enchantement : +3
TAC0 : +3
Dégâts : 1d6 +6

STAF09
Staff of Command +3
This item is of the kind used by nefarious people seeking to sway others to follow their ways. Enchanters are often found wielding staves such as this, but this unique specimen belonged to Morinth the Bewitcher.

This staff allows the wielder to dominate another creature's mind, or destroy it with a strike, but the staff's ability to enhance the potency of all enchantments cast by its wielder is what mindbenders seek the most.

Possessing the power to manipulate other's minds doesn't ensure immunity to the same treatment, as Morinth's death proved when she was ambushed and abducted by a group of mind flayers equally interested in her brain and her staff.

STATISTICS:

Special abilities:
– Domination (once per day)

Equipped abilities:
– Aura of Command: opponents within 15 ft. suffer -2 to saves vs. spell

Combat abilities:
– Mindbreaking: 15% chance target is feebleminded permanently (save vs. Spell at -4 negates)

THAC0: +3
Damage: 1d6+3 (crushing)
Speed Factor: 4
Proficiency Type: Quarterstaff
Type: Two-handed
Requires:
 5 Strength

Weight: 4
This item is of the kind used by nefarious people seeking to sway others to follow their ways. Enchanters are often found wielding staves such as this, but this unique specimen belonged to Morinth the Bewitcher.

This staff allows the wielder to dominate another creature's mind, or destroy it with a strike, but the staff's ability to enhance the potency of all enchantments cast by its wielder is what mindbenders seek the most.

Possessing the power to manipulate other's minds doesn't ensure immunity to the same treatment, as Morinth's death proved when she was ambushed and abducted by a group of mind flayers equally interested in her brain and her staff.

PARAMÈTRES : 

Capacités d'équipement : 
- Multiplicateur d'attaque sournoise : -2

Capacités de charge : 
- Domination (1 fois par jour)

Capacités de combat : 
- 15 % de chance d'infliger Débilité mentale à la cible (jet de sauvegarde contre les sorts à -4 pour éviter)

Enchantement : +3
TAC0 : +3
Dégâts : 1d6 +3
Type de dégâts : Contondant
Facteur de vitesse : 4
Type de compétence : Bâton
Type : Arme à 2 mains

Poids : 4

Nécessite : 
- Force : 5
STAF10
Staff of Curing +1
These items are said to manifest during times of great trouble, though the entity responsible varies depending on whose followers you question. Many have begun to think the staffs a gift of the combined gods of good alignment, deities that know their faithful must struggle, and that there is always a need for a healing hand.

STAF11
Staff of the Magi +5
This type of staff is thoroughly linked to the image of the spellcasting profession, rare though it is. It is among the most powerful tools that a wizard can possess, the culmination of complex enchantment and endless study. With the secrets of their creation all but lost, such staffs are more often found in the hoards of ancient dragons than the hands of living wizards.

STATISTICS:

Special abilities:
– Remove Magic (three times per day)
– Spell Trap (once per day): 1 turn

Equipped abilities:
– Magic Resistance: +20%
– Spell: True Seeing

Combat abilities:
– Dispelling: removes all magical effects from the target (save vs. Spell negates)

THAC0: +5
Damage: 1d6+5 (crushing)
Speed Factor: 4
Proficiency Type: Quarterstaff
Type: Two-handed
Requires:
 5 Strength

Weight: 4
This type of staff is thoroughly linked to the image of the spellcasting profession, rare though it is. It is among the most powerful tools that a wizard can possess, the culmination of complex enchantment and endless study. With the secrets of their creation all but lost, such staffs are more often found in the hoards of ancient dragons than the hands of living wizards.

PARAMÈTRES : 

Capacités d'équipement : 
- Multiplicateur d'attaque sournoise : -2
- Résistance à la magie : +20 %
- Immunité au sort Mot de pouvoir : Cécité
- Immunité au sort Hantise
- Immunité au sort Cécité
- Immunité à la cécité
- Immunité à l'aveuglement
- Permet au porteur d'attaquer une créature cachée ou invisible

Capacités de charge : 
- Remove Magic (3 fois par jour)
- Spell Trap (1 fois par jour)

Capacités de combat : 
- Dissipation de la magie (jet de sauvegarde contre les sorts pour éviter)

Enchantement : +5
TAC0 : +5
Dégâts : 1d6 +5

Facteur de vitesse : 4
Type de compétence : Bâton

STAF12
Staff of Power +3
Staffs of Power are immediately familiar to most spellcasters, and are almost icons of arcane study. The inherent utility of such staffs has resulted in many being crafted or commissioned, and specific histories are usually lost in the crowd.

– Globe of Invulnerability (once per day): 1 turn

– Saving Throws: +2
